Title: Customer Data Analyst to Sift Lab
Description:
Sift Lab is an innovative SaaS AI start-up and they are scaling rapidly and are now looking for a driven and curious Customer Data Analyst to join their Customer success team.

Sift Lab is a pioneering AI platform enabling retail and e-commerce companies to predict and optimize their business. Based on world-leading AI-research from Umeå University, their predictive analytics, segmentation and recommendation platform turbocharges customers’ current marketing technology infrastructure at a fraction of the cost of legacy solutions. Today, they are trusted by leading ecom, retailers and consultancies and work closely with leading researchers in AI. 40+ customers in Sweden and the Nordics, such as Rusta, Nordic Nest, Bokus and Caia Cosmetics

About the role:
The Customer success team is responsible for ensuring that the Sift Lab platform delivers maximum value to their clients. You will be working on technical onboarding and operations, implementation and development of new customer use cases and features, on-going tech & user support and driving the data analytics roadmap for each client.

Responsibilities include:

Onboard new clients on platform; setting up new data imports and exports, set up of key features in analytics, AI segmentations and recommendations omni-channel.
Together with Account Manager develop a value realization roadmap for each customer i.e in what order to implement use cases for.
Consult clients on new use cases on the platform, optimization/testing of new segmentations and recommendations.
Handle complex technical queries.
Continuously identify areas for improvement, and implement effective service management practices.
Contribute to and develop new analytical, segmentation and recommendation solutions beyond standard functionalities based on customer feedback to further enhance the Sift Lab platform capabilities.


About you:
For this role, we are looking for someone specialized in digital analytics who, like us, is independent, detail/service oriented, and curious about new technologies. You have strong communication skills and can convey complex analytical findings in a clear and understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.

Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
3-5 years of practical experience of customer data analytics, with a focus on CRM and loyalty programs.
Proven track record of successfully applying data science techniques to improve customer acquisition, engagement and loyalty in previous roles.
Proficient in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and predictive modeling.
Experience with machine learning algorithms, such as regression analysis, decision trees, clustering, and neural networks.
Proficiency in using tools like SQL, GDS, Tableau or Power BI and experience working with large datasets.

Required language skills

Fluency in English & Swedish

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Merkle Sweden - a Dentsu company is a consultancy firm with expertise in the areas of digital analytics and conversion optimization. We help large corporations and organizations collect, interpret, and act on data from their digital touchpoints, such as apps and websites, and use the data to make their communications and marketing efforts more hard-hitting.

Our extensive experience and deep proficiency in Google Analytics 360 and Google Optimize mean that our clients rely on us for their most complex, challenging assignments.

Job Description:

Merkle is looking for a driven specialist with a huge interest in data and analytics. You’ll be based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.


Implement metrics for clients and provide regular analysis.
Give recommendations for measurement solutions for digital services based on clients’ business and activity goals.
Maintain and develop a strong know-how of Google Marketing Platform in general and Google Analytics 360 in particular. Other measurement tools may be used.
Provide insights and recommendations that improve clients’ activities and business.
Develop data-visualization solutions (in dashboards) that make it possible for clients to follow sales and other important performance indicators in real time.



Qualifications:


Minimum of 3 years’ experience in similar role
Experience working with large amounts of data and an understanding of SQL and databases.
In-depth knowledge of working with Google Analytics data, being an advanced user.
Presentation skills to both large and small groups of varying degrees of knowledge, internally within the Group and also with clients.
Ability to manage different work tasks and projects and prioritize accordingly as you will be working with several clients and projects at the same time.
Ability to work with data analysis and provide accurate recommendations based on data.
Knowledge of data-visualization tools, formal statistics training, and experience with Google Cloud (especially BigQuery) are desirable.
Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.



Some of the Perks We Offer:


We have a collective agreement and attractive benefits. Several years in a row, we have won the DI Gasell Award, won the Mästargasellen Award, and been named a “Superföretag” (Super Company) by Veckans Affärer and Bisnode.
Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
Possibility to work with multinational companies in a number of different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
Continuous personal development in the form of lab days, groups exchanging experiences, and your own professional development budget.
The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle Northern Europe is a part of.



Inclusion and Diversity:

Our diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.

We are happy to discuss flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly. If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.

About dentsu:

Dentsu Group is a global marketing communications company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the largest advertising and media firms in the world. The company offers a wide range of services in advertising, marketing, communication, and digital media, catering to clients across various industries.

We help clients to win, keep, and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses with the best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. For more information please see: www.dentsu.com.

Working with us:

Joining dentsu, you’ll join a team of 72,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures, and experiences.  We offer exciting challenges, a great working environment, memorable experiences, and opportunities to shape your future.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com or by phone at: +45 53 84 75 82

 

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Merkle

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

HTML:
Job Description:

Merkle Sweden - a Dentsu company is a consultancy firm with expertise in the areas of digital analytics and conversion optimization. We help large corporations and organizations collect, interpret, and act on data from their digital touchpoints, such as apps and websites, and use the data to make their communications and marketing efforts more hard-hitting.

Our extensive experience and deep proficiency in Google Analytics 360 and Google Optimize mean that our clients rely on us for their most complex, challenging assignments.

Job Description:

Merkle is looking for a driven specialist with a huge interest in data and analytics. You’ll be based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.

  • Implement metrics for clients and provide regular analysis.
  • Give recommendations for measurement solutions for digital services based on clients’ business and activity goals.
  • Maintain and develop a strong know-how of Google Marketing Platform in general and Google Analytics 360 in particular. Other measurement tools may be used.
  • Provide insights and recommendations that improve clients’ activities and business.
  • Develop data-visualization solutions (in dashboards) that make it possible for clients to follow sales and other important performance indicators in real time.


Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in similar role
  • Experience working with large amounts of data and an understanding of SQL and databases.
  • In-depth knowledge of working with Google Analytics data, being an advanced user.
  • Presentation skills to both large and small groups of varying degrees of knowledge, internally within the Group and also with clients.
  • Ability to manage different work tasks and projects and prioritize accordingly as you will be working with several clients and projects at the same time.
  • Ability to work with data analysis and provide accurate recommendations based on data.
  • Knowledge of data-visualization tools, formal statistics training, and experience with Google Cloud (especially BigQuery) are desirable.
  • Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.


Some of the Perks We Offer:

  • We have a collective agreement and attractive benefits. Several years in a row, we have won the DI Gasell Award, won the Mästargasellen Award, and been named a “Superföretag” (Super Company) by Veckans Affärer and Bisnode.
  • Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
  • Possibility to work with multinational companies in a number of different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
  • Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
  • Continuous personal development in the form of lab days, groups exchanging experiences, and your own professional development budget.
  • The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle Northern Europe is a part of.


Inclusion and Diversity:

Our diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.

We are happy to discuss flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly. If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com or by phone at: +45 53 84 75 82

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
ICA Sverige söker en Lead Data Analyst – Replenishment

ICA Sverige är mitt i en spännande resa där vi migrerar vår data till Google Cloud. Vi söker nu en Lead Data Analyst för att stödja vårt arbete inom Replenishment. Replenishment är en del inom ICA Sveriges logistikfunktion med huvudsyfte att säkra varutillgången till butik och skapa förutsättningar för en kostnadseffektiv varuförsörjning. Är du en analytisk problemlösare med en passion för data och dess möjligheter? Då kan du vara den vi söker!

Om rollen:

Som Lead Data Analyst kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att skapa förutsättningar för att optimera och kvalitetssäkra våra processer. I denna rollen är du huvudansvarig för att säkerställa datatillgänglighet och driva utvecklingen av datadrivna arbetssätt inom Replenishment. Du blir en nyckelspelare i att hjälpa oss att fatta datadrivna beslut genom att säkerställa att rätt data finns tillgänglig och lämpligt paketerad.

Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:


Driva vår resa med att migrera data till Google Cloud och implementera nya verktyg och tekniker för analys.
Leda arbetet med att utveckla rapporter i aktuella BI-verktyg som t.ex. Tableau, Excel, Google Big Query, Power BI och Celonis. Arbetet sker utifrån ett kundperspektiv där verksamhetens behov styr.
Identifiera och förädla use cases från verksamheten för att driva Replenishment framåt inom datadrivna arbetssätt.
Säkerställer Replenishments intressen vid central utveckling av informationsdatakällor och deltar i projekt vid behov.
Bidra i tvärfunktionella prioforum för logistik och Replenishment med fokus på att säkra prioriteringar och driva utveckling inom det datadrivna.
Ansvara för att datahantering inom Replenishment sker på ett sätt som är i linje med ICA:s säkerhetspolicy.



Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som har en stark bakgrund inom dataanalys och som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora datamängder i molnmiljöer, gärna inom Google Cloud. Du är lösningsorienterad och kan arbeta både operativt och strategiskt för att möta verksamhetens databehov. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:


Kandidatexamen i statistik, datavetenskap, ekonomi eller relaterat område.
Flera års erfarenhet av dataanalys, gärna inom logistik eller supply chain.
Erfarenhet av arbete med Google Cloud eller liknande molnplattformar.
Kunskap om SQL, Python och verktyg för datavisualisering (t.ex. Looker, Tableau eller Power BI).
Starka kommunikations- och samarbetsförmågor samt vana att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team.
Förmåga att arbeta med både strategiska och operativa frågor samt att prioritera utifrån affärsbehov.
Erfarenhet av att självständigt driva analyser och presentera insikter för verksamheten.
Förmåga att utbilda och stötta medarbetare i användningen av data och analysverktyg.



Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt engagerade team som arbetar för att säkerställa att ICA Sverige fortsätter att vara ledande inom logistik och Replenishment!

Om ICA Gruppen

ICA gruppen är ett av Nordens ledande detaljhandelsföretag med verksamhet inom mat och måltider, bank, apotek, specialvaror och fastigheter. ICAs värderingar grundar sig på enkelhet, engagemang och entreprenörskap. Balansen mellan individens drivkraft och kraften i det gemensamma är en del av vår framgång. Har du vilja och egna idéer finns en mängd möjligheter att lyckas hos oss.

Sista dag för ansökan är 2024-10-25

Intervjuer sker löpande och vi ser fram emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt, tillträdesdatum enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, heltid med placeringsort Västerås eller Solna.

Kontaktperson:

Tom Söderberg chef Varuflödesanalys

E-post:

tom.soderberg@ica.se

Telefonnummer:

072 220 26 99

ICA ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför. Vi värnar om goda förutsättningar för ett hållbart arbetsliv för våra medarbetare med god arbetsmiljö och möjlighet till ständig utveckling. Vi tillämpar drogtestning i samband med rekryteringsförfarandet. 
Show more

Title: Graduates 2025 - Data, AI & Machine Learning
Description:
Intro

Are you a curious and ambitious AI/ML/data enthusiast ready to dive headfirst into data and client projects on an exciting adventure after graduation? Then join us at Curamando and turn your passion into impactful, groundbreaking solutions!

Curamando is a fast-growing consultancy offering services in areas such as top-line revenue growth, digital strategy and analysis, working with clients like Polestar, Samsung and Alleima. We are part of the Nordic consulting house, Eidra, with our main office on the newly refurbished block Grev Tureplan 1 in central Stockholm. In total, we are over 1200 employees, located in nine offices from Stockholm to New York.




About The Graduate Position

We are looking for students graduating in the Summer of 2025 to join our Insights & Analytics team in August. Our team consists of experts within both AI/ML/data science and data engineering/data architecture, so you will get to decide which area you want to specialize in or if you want to gain experiences in both, aligned with your personal goals and preferences. Coming directly from university, you would be joining us as an Analyst, our entry level position. As an Analyst, you will be working alongside senior colleagues and helping with implementing our digital solutions for clients. We believe that learning and doing are important parts of your early career, which is why we immediately want you to get your hands dirty (with code) and get to try out the skills you’ve developed during your education. General responsibilities include:




Partaking in client conversations and projects
Delivering data science and/or data engineering solutions, for example:
ML/AI based models, ranging from random forest classifications to LLM:s
Automating workflows
Building data pipelines to integrate data across the business and deliver insights
Designing and implementing modern cloud-based data platforms
Collaborating with other Curamando teams and companies within Eidra
Representing the company in outreach events, for instance case studies for students or AI lectures for clients
Researching and implementing the latest technologies in our field, such as OpenAI’s and Google’s AI models




As an Graduate, you will also have the opportunity to participate in our Analyst Program along with fellow graduates from different domains, packed with exciting events and courses!

The Analyst Program

The Analyst program includes a set of courses, designed to ensure sure that you, during your first year at Curamando, develop the crucial skills to be a professional data consultant. It also includes social activities and meeting and visiting colleagues from our different companies and offices around the world.




Who We Are Looking For

To be a good fit for this role, we believe that you

will be graduating in the Summer of 2025 with a master’s degree in data science, machine learning, AI, computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, industrial engineering or similar
have skills in Python, SQL, or similar languages
have skills in, or a strong interest in learning about, data related methods and solutions for company growth
are a curious, collaborative team player, eager to grow and learn
have great communication skills, both written and verbal, in English
are based in Stockholm, or able to move here




Our recruitment process and how to apply

The first step of our recruitment process involves an online test that assess your personality traits. If meeting our initial criteria, you will be invited to participate in an Assessment Day at our Stockholm office, where you can expect a company introduction, an interview and you will present a homebased case that you have prepared in advance. After the assessment days, we will carefully evaluate your performance and overall fit with our organization, and make a final decision regarding your suitability for the position.

To apply, please click “Apply for this job” and follow the instructions. Apply the latest on 20th of October.

We’re looking forward to hearing from you!




About Curamando

At Curamando, we work in diverse cross-functional teams of business consultants, data and AI/ML experts, project managers, and more. We celebrate autonomy, initiative, and responsibility, while always maintaining a secure support network of fellow colleagues. With tasks ranging from cutting-edge AI implementations to complex and sustainable data architectures, no two days are the same. As a recent graduate, you'll find yourself in an environment that's perfect for learning and development. Rather than being a small cog in the machine, you'll feel the direct impact of your contributions. Because at Curamando, your ideas and efforts aren't just valued – they're essential to our collective success and your professional growth.

Curamando offers tailored consulting services with the best people and assets to help clients build competitive digital marketing and sales capabilities to reach their business goals.

We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

Show more

Title: Analyst Consultant - Risk Analytics
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You’ll join our global Risk & Resilience Practice in one of our European offices and be part of the Risk Analytics team. 

Risk Analytics is the tech-enablement power engine of Risk & Resilience. We combine deep analytical and technical expertise with distinctive strategy and transformation capabilities to support clients in everything - from large-scale analytics programs to in-depth technical modelling exercises.

We develop and deploy leading-edge solutions incorporating the latest innovations in methodology and technology and maintain in-depth knowledge of regulatory developments. We convene leaders in the industry to build and share knowledge to drive long-term sustainable change in the practice of risk data and analytics.

We have over 18 years of expertise serving leading institutions across industries in the fields of model development, model advisory, model validation, and model risk management.

We are a diverse global community of world-class practitioners with a shared passion to build risk analytics capabilities that break new ground, transform industries, and shape markets. We solve real life business problems for our clients; work with us and you will learn from the best and have your voice heard from day one.

There is flexibility to hire at the Analyst or Senior Analyst level depending on candidate experience.

What You'll Do

As an Analyst Consultant in Risk Analytics, you will


Help clients to develop, refine and review their models using cutting-edge technology to better manage risk, assess market opportunities and create business benefits, across different areas of expertise.
Assess our clients’ frameworks for model development and risk management across a variety of risk topics. This includes credit risk, market and trading risk, climate risk, financial crime and compliance and wider applications such as cyber and digital trust.
Analyze content and data, identify risk vectors, build prototypes, interpret results, find new solutions, derive conclusions, support clients to implement recommendations, and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value.
Be expected to communicate complex analytics concepts in a clear and concise manner to key client stakeholders 
Be able to establish connections between sophisticated modelling techniques and strategic decision-making processes. You will have exposure to a highly international environment as our client base is global 
Work on projects and exchange experiences with your colleagues which means you will face new intellectual challenges daily, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills, as well as your strategic consultancy toolkit


RiskandR

Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced quantitative degree (Masters or Ph.D. in computer science, mathematics/statistics, engineering, or financial engineering) would be a plus
2+ years of relevant experience in risk quantitative analysis/modelling to solve real world problems  
Experience across model lifecycle, including active participation in activities of development, implementation and/or testing of risk models (vendor or “in-house” models) 
First experience in programming (beyond simple scripts) in a modern scientific language (e.g., Python, Matlab, R). Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB, Ignite) and SAS would be a strong plus 
Experience in one of the following machine learning / AI areas natural language processing, deep learning, anomaly detection, graph-based techniques would be a strong plus 
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization 
Exceptional communication skills - especially around translating technical knowledge into forms that can be digested by leadership and non-technical project teams-, verbally and in writing, in English and the local office language(s) 
Willingness to travel 
Show more

  • Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced quantitative degree (Masters or Ph.D. in computer science, mathematics/statistics, engineering, or financial engineering) would be a plus
  • 2+ years of relevant experience in risk quantitative analysis/modelling to solve real world problems  
  • Experience across model lifecycle, including active participation in activities of development, implementation and/or testing of risk models (vendor or “in-house” models) 
  • First experience in programming (beyond simple scripts) in a modern scientific language (e.g., Python, Matlab, R). Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB, Ignite) and SAS would be a strong plus 
  • Experience in one of the following machine learning / AI areas natural language processing, deep learning, anomaly detection, graph-based techniques would be a strong plus 
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization 
  • Exceptional communication skills - especially around translating technical knowledge into forms that can be digested by leadership and non-technical project teams-, verbally and in writing, in English and the local office language(s) 
  • Willingness to travel

Title: Battery Data Analyst
Description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 1+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

Rollbeskrivning:

About The Customer

Our successful customer in trucks and heavy vehicles in Mälardalen is currently in a transition and is converting to electric operation. The customer, who is located in Södertälje, needs a consultant for their electrification projects.

THE ASSIGNMENT

We are now looking for a consultant who will be analyzing the data from battery testing regarding the electrified vehicles, both truck and bus. The data will be collected from different tests conducted by the team and need to be analyzed. You will be part of a team working to develop the future batteries. The assignment does not require you to be onsite weekly but you should be able to be there when the tasks demand it.

Requirements Profile

If you have previous experience with battery development, it is meriting. Your background is probably within CFD/Structural dynamics and it is preferable if you have experience working with Matlab and Python.

Ansökan

Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

Arbetsplats och kultur

Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.

Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: Data Scientist/Analyst
Description:
Vår vision är att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor. För att lyckas i det arbetet behöver vi skapa förståelse och insikter om våra kunders beteenden. Låter det kul att skapa den förståelsen genom datadriven analys? Vill du dessutom bli del av ett drivet och engagerat analysteam som lägger stor vikt vid ödmjukhet, sammanhållning och att ha kul tillsammans? Läs vidare!




Om rollen

Vi söker dig som vill jobba med Data Science och analys, och lockas av att arbeta datadrivet. Som Data Scientist/Analytiker hos oss jobbar du nära utvecklingsteamen med analyser, insikter och uppföljningar av produkter, funktioner och mycket annat. Parallellt stöttar du övriga delar av Avanza kring affärs- och datarelaterade frågor.




Du kommer även ha ansvar för större, teamöverskridande projekt där djupare insikter och modellering av kundbeteende kan hjälpa oss att ta nästa steg i att förstå hur vi bäst hjälper våra kunder och följer upp på våra mål. Det genomgående fokuset är att analysera våra produkter, vår affär och våra kunder och dela dessa insikter för att hjälpa Avanza att fatta bättre beslut.

Du kommer ingå i vår centrala analysarea som består av 7 personer. I gruppen finns kollegor med olika spetskompetenser som gör att vi kompletterar varandra och tillsammans kan stötta hela Avanza med analyser och insikter.




I rollen ingår att:

Stötta utvecklingsteamen med datahantering, analys och beslutsunderlag i deras löpande arbete och driva på för ett mer datadrivet arbetssätt
Utvärdera samt följa upp nya produkter, funktioner och kampanjer
Utveckla statistiska-/ML-modeller som kan hjälpa oss förstå vår affär och våra kunder bättre.
Sprida insikter och statistik vidare i organisationen
Delta i att bygga upp en analysmiljö på Avanza avseende såväl data som metodik
Utbilda, inspirera och dela med dig av din kunskap både inom gruppen och inom Avanza i stort




Om dig

I den här rollen får du stor möjlighet och uppmuntran att utvecklas i din roll och inom ditt specialistområde, så vi tror med fördel att du är nyfiken!




Dessutom tror vi att du har:

Universitetsutbildning inom matematik, statistik, datavetenskap alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
Har erfarenhet av att jobba i BI-system
Har god erfarenhet av kund- och affärsanalys
Har erfarenhet av SQL/BigQuery, samt statistisk-/ML-modellering med hjälp av Python och Notebook.




Meriterande:

Har erfarenhet av att visualisera statistik, tex i form av dashboards eller i presentationer
Är trygg med att hålla presentationer och dragningar för både team och större grupper




För att lyckas i den här rollen är du inte bara skicklig inom ditt specialistområde utan vi tror även att du matchar in på de personliga egenskaper vi söker:




I denna roll söker vi en person som värdesätter samarbete och bidrar till att skapa en positiv och givande arbetsmiljö för sina kollegor. Du är snabbtänkt, nyfiken och har en stark vilja att lära dig nya saker och metoder. Du tar dig an komplexa uppgifter med självförtroende och har en förmåga att snabbt anpassa dig till förändringar och utveckla nya färdigheter.




Som en aktiv deltagare i diskussioner och en tydlig kommunikatör, hjälper du teamet och andra samarbetspartners att nå beslut. Du är noggrann, resultatinriktad och van vid att sätta upp och följa mål både för dig själv och för projektet.




Ansökan:

Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast den 20 Oktober. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR. Välkommen med din ansökan!




Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.

Title: Data Engineer till KPMG
Description:
Drivs du av att hjälpa olika typer av organisationer bearbeta och strukturera sin data för att möjliggöra analys? Tror du på datadriven innovation? Skulle du vilja utmanas och utvecklas snabbt tillsammans med oss genom rollen som konsult ute hos våra kunder? Då är denna roll för dig! Vi på KPMG bygger nu ut framtidens konsultavdelning inom BI & Analytics. Vi letar efter dig som attraheras av att både sitta ute hos våra kunder, samt vara med oss internt och bygga vidare på ett framgångsrikt team. Hos oss får du de verktyg du behöver för att lyckas, och blir en del av ett stöttande team. Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av en inspirerande arbetsplats med engagerade kollegor.

Om oss och ditt uppdrag

Onsite Solutions består idag av cirka 60 drivna konsulter, fördelade över Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö. Vi är ett sammansvetsat team och ses ofta som KPMG:s "startup", för att vi inte bara vågar tänka stort – vi genomför också våra idéer. Vi är verksamma inom Finance, Data Analytics/BI och HR, och på grund av den höga efterfrågan på vår expertis expanderar vi nu vårt team i Stockholm.

Våra kunder finns representerade i flera olika branscher och innefattar både några av Sveriges största bolag samt mindre entreprenöriella startups. Även uppdragens art är varierande, ofta kommer vi in som en tillfällig kompetensförstärkning eller vid behov av extra kompetens. Vi kan ta oss an de flesta roller inom BI & Analytics, och stannar så länge vi behövs. Vår ambition är att vara en självklar affärspartner, identifiera kundens förbättringsområden och leverera datadrivna lösningar. Vi arbetar oftast på plats hos kunden och blir en integrerad del av organisationen. Att rätt konsult hamnar hos rätt kund är det absolut viktigaste för ett lyckat uppdrag, varav att vi lägger stor vikt i den matchningen och vi är intresserade av just den kompetens du kommer in med.

Vi tror att de bästa besluten baseras på relevant och korrekt data. Ditt uppdrag som konsult inom BI & Analytics är att supportera våra kunder med din expertis. Du driver projekt och utför uppdrag inom exempelvis KPI-automation, data visualisering, utbildning av visualiseringsverktyg och bidrar med strategisk dataanalys till effektiva och professionella leveranser från oss på KPMG.

Vad vi erbjuder

På KPMG är din personliga utveckling central. När du börjar hos oss får du en dedikerad Performance Manager som coachar och stöttar dig i din karriärutveckling. Vi erbjuder en tydlig utvecklingstrappa som ger dig möjligheten att forma din framtid. För rätt kandidat är möjligheterna många!

Idag är vi fyra konsulter som verkar inom BI & Analytics området, men alla inom Onsite Solutions blir dina närmsta kollegor. Vi garanterar att du blir en del av ett socialt, lärande och inspirerande gäng. Som konsult hos oss är du alltid uppbackad av kompetenta kollegor som finns tillgängliga för stöd och expertis i dina uppdrag. Utöver konsultuppdrag anordnar vi regelbundet aktiviteter som AWs, resor, gemensamma träningspass och middagar. Vår interna kultur och starka gemenskap är centrala för oss!

,

För att lyckas hos oss på Onsite Solutions BI & Analytics ser vi att du bör ha:


Universitets- eller högskoleexamen inom relevant område, på kandidat- eller masternivå.
Minst 2 års jobberfarenhet inom en liknande roll.
Kunskap i Python och/eller SQL.
Erfarenhet av datavisualiseringsverktyg som Tableau, PowerBI, Looker och/eller Qlik.
Pratar affärsmässig svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.


Vi ser det som meriterande om du har följande:


Meriterande med kunskap inom molntjänster som AWS, Azure och/eller GCP.
Meriterande med kunskap inom datawarehousing och verktyg som Redshift, Snowflake eller motsvarande.
God kännedom om ELT/ETL, datamodellering, transformering och visualisering.


I övrigt värdesätter vi att du är en initiativtagande person som får saker att hända, och är snabb på att etablera nätverk. Vi tror att du föredrar att arbeta strukturerat, noggrant och effektivt, samt har en god kommunikativ förmåga. Hos oss finns alla möjligheter att bredda eller fördjupa din kompetens. Vi har höga ambitioner för vår affär och söker dig som verkligen vill vara med och skapa en exceptionellt bra konsultverksamhet. Vi är ett tight team som peppar varandra och bjussar på både kompetens och erfarenheter, och räknar med att du gör detsamma.

Vill du vara med och göra skillnad med oss?

Så, vill du vara med och bygga framtidens konsultavdelning inom BI & Analytics med oss? Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsmodell med utgångspunkt i Stockholm. Urval sker löpande. Vill du veta mer om tjänsten innan du söker är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Hedvig Gåve på Hedvig.gave@kpmg.se

Eftersom vår framgång bygger på briljanta medarbetare, och vi strävar efter en mångfaldig arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna, har vi en rekryteringsprocess som säkerställer att vi är en perfekt match, samtidigt som vi ser till att processen är rättvis och fri från omedvetna fördomar. Rekryteringsprocessen inkluderar:


Telefonavstämning
Kognitiva färdighetstester och personlighetsformulär
Kompetensbaserad intervju
Caseintervju
Referenstagning


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Title: Informationsarkitekt - Data & Analytics
Description:
Arbetsuppgifter


Utveckla begreppsmodeller, informationsmodeller och datamodeller
Ansvara för masterdata på Data & Analytics och processer relaterade till masterdata
Driva avdelningens arbete med Data governance


Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

På SBAB vill alla framåt och vi motiveras av att ständigt förbättra för våra kunder. Även om tempot ibland är snabbt så kompromissar vi aldrig på att vara en hållbar arbetsplats där medarbetarnas utveckling står i fokus. Det hänger också ihop. Tempo, medarbetarfokus och utveckling. När du tar initiativ, vågar utmana, prova nytt och utveckla vår verksamhet kommer du också att utvecklas. Det händer att våra medarbetare växer ur sin roll och kliver in i en annan. På så sätt blir din drivkraft utvecklingsmöjligheter både för dig och för oss. Låter det bra? Välkommen!

Att jobba som Informationsarkitekt

Som Informationsarkitekt hos Data & Analytics kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att bygga och förädla den grund som vår data- och informationshantering vilar på. Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi organiserar och strukturerar vår information, vilket är avgörande för vår förmåga att fatta datadrivna beslut och skapa värde för våra kunder. Genom att utveckla avancerade begrepps-, informations- och datamodeller, samt leda workshops och analyser, kommer du att säkerställa att vi har en tydlig och effektiv informationsstruktur. Ditt arbete med att skapa och underhålla dokumentation samt ansvara för masterdata och relaterade processer kommer att vara centralt för vår Data & analytics-avdelning. Dessutom kommer du att spela en aktiv roll i vårt arkitekturstyrningsarbete och fungera som en drivande kraft i implementeringen av vår Data governance-strategi.

Om detta låter intressant, då är det dags att bli en del av vårt team! SBAB välkomnar dig till en växande Data & analytics-avdelning. Du kommer att ha möjligheten att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.

Vi ser gärna att du:


Har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område, eller har en bakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och verksamhetsarkitektur genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
Besitter flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsarkitektur, och är van vid att arbeta med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer.
Har erfarenhet av 3NF, Data vault och Inmon- eller Kimbalmodellering.
Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både i tal och skrift, på svenska och engelska.
Har erfarenhet av Data governance och masterdataplattformar.


Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har fräscha träningslokaler, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista.

Har du check på allt?


Analytisk
Helhetsperspektiv
Initiativtagande
Kommunikativ
Strukturerad


Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.
Show more

Arbetsuppgifter

  • Utveckla begreppsmodeller, informationsmodeller och datamodeller
  • Ansvara för masterdata på Data & Analytics och processer relaterade till masterdata
  • Driva avdelningens arbete med Data governance

Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

På SBAB vill alla framåt och vi motiveras av att ständigt förbättra för våra kunder. Även om tempot ibland är snabbt så kompromissar vi aldrig på att vara en hållbar arbetsplats där medarbetarnas utveckling står i fokus. Det hänger också ihop. Tempo, medarbetarfokus och utveckling. Dessutom kommer du att spela en aktiv roll i vårt arkitekturstyrningsarbete och fungera som en drivande kraft i implementeringen av vår Data governance-strategi.

Om detta låter intressant, då är det dags att bli en del av vårt team! SBAB välkomnar dig till en växande Data & analytics-avdelning. Du kommer att ha möjligheten att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.

Vi ser gärna att du:

  • Har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område, eller har en bakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och verksamhetsarkitektur genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
  • Besitter flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsarkitektur, och är van vid att arbeta med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer.
  • Har erfarenhet av 3NF, Data vault och Inmon- eller Kimbalmodellering.
  • Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både i tal och skrift, på svenska och engelska.
  • Har erfarenhet av Data governance och masterdataplattformar.

Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har fräscha träningslokaler, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista.

Har du check på allt?

  • Analytisk
  • Helhetsperspektiv
  • Initiativtagande
  • Kommunikativ
  • Strukturerad

Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
⚡️ What We Do

Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.

With industry-leading AI software at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.

🌟The Team

We're committed to shaping tomorrow's energy system with flexible power at its core. Our ambitious team shares a common goal, working together to create a sustainable future. We are now looking for a passionate and skilled Data Engineer based in Stockholm to fulfill that goal with us.

👩‍💻 About The Role

We are looking for a passionate, self-driven and dedicated Data Engineer to join our Implementation and Operations team. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and systems that power our data-driven solutions. You will also work closely with our Data Scientists from the Trading Strategy and Modeling team. Your work will contribute to the development and maintenance of an important stage in our solutions, by making sure that the data travels seamlessly from end to end in our pipelines.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain scalable, robust, and efficient data pipelines
Build and optimize data ingestion and processing systems for structured and unstructured data
Work with the data science team to maintain data models and build and maintain MLOps and ETL pipelines
Implement and maintain data quality checks, validation, and monitoring
Create and maintain CI/CD pipelines in GitHub and AWS
Build and maintain data lake and storage solutions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and develop data-driven solutions
Design and implement data security and privacy controls
Create and maintain documentation of data pipelines, processes, and procedures


Qualifications


3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or similar role
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL
Familiarity with DevOps practices such as Docker, CI/CD, git, testing
Familiarity with cloud data services, preferably from AWS, such as Lambda
Understanding of data modeling, data storage, and database design
Knowledge of data security and privacy regulations and best practices


📍 Location

We value office collaboration but support some hybrid work. Our office is at Söder Mälarstrand, minutes away from Gamla Stan subway station in Stockholm.

🛒 Apply

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and why you feel you would be a great addition to our team. In the recruitment process you will meet with the Talent Acquisition Specialist, Engineering Team, Hiring Manager and the CEO.

Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office, so we want you to submit your CV in English.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Graduate and Junior Management Consulting Analysts to Accenture Consulting
Description:
Are you a recent graduate or about to graduate from university? Do you see a future career in Consulting? Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity! Take this opportunity as a Consulting Analyst to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career!

About Accenture And Consulting 

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions — underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network — Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With more than 710,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives.

Through deep industry expertise, analytics and insights, we empower clients to survive and thrive in the new, the now and the unknown. To stay agile in a world dominated by change, the C-suite must keep the core business running while simultaneously identifying and investing in the new. Accenture Consulting enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology. 

About Our Functions And Industries

Accenture Consulting consists of a wide range of business functions and industry groups. Main functions for Consulting Analysts include Finance, Supply Chain, HR and Technology. Primary industries include Retail, Consumer Goods & Services, Banking, Insurance, Capital Markets, Comms & Media, Utilities, Industrial Equipment, Automotive, Health. Read more about our business functions and industries here.   

 

Consulting Analysts within Industry and Functional Consulting Industry and Functional Consulting leverage industry and functional expertise and data-driven insights to advise, design and implement transformational solutions to reimagine business functions and create new business models for our clients. As a Consulting Analyst, you’ll work as part of a project team to build enduring, trust-based relationships and work with clients to identify market opportunities that transform their businesses across people, process and technology. You’ll get early responsibility and build your skills and expertise through interesting and challenging work.

Work you will do as a Consulting Analyst



Apply insights and knowledge to help clients navigate in a changing business environment, optimize their business and leverage their talent 


Help clients identify and unlock value in their business using benchmarks, interviews and workshops  


Design and implement end-to-end business processes to transform our clients’ business  


Define client needs by identifying and documenting business requirements, before agreeing what needs to change and which opportunities to take advantage of 


Define how the client will evolve to the future state— i.e., the impact of the changes and the steps we will take to help the leaders, employees, customers and others adapt quickly to new ways of working. 



 

What’s in it for you:  



Great development opportunities to start building your professional career 


Extensive training to develop your business acumen, technical and professional skills including on-the-job learning and formal training  


Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization - including methodology, knowledge databases, expert networks and benchmarks 


A dedicated mentor to guide you in your career at Accenture 


Inspiring colleagues to support you in your daily work 


Over time, you will also have leadership responsibilities and lead teams



Job Qualifications

Who we are looking for:  



You have a master's degree and / or will receive your degree within one year of applying 


You can start at Accenture in late summer/autumn 2025  


You have proven strong academic results in a relevant field 


You are an analytical problem-solver with strong business acumen 


You are ambitious, driven, solution-oriented and eager to start your career in an advisory role 


You have excellent written and oral presentation skills


You are fluent in English. Swedish is beneficial but not required 



Office and start

We are looking for graduates to join our offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg and Malmö in late summer/autumn 2025. Mobility and flexibility to either work physically at an office (client or Accenture), or in a virtual “home office” is expected. This requires you to both have a high degree of flexibility for travelling to our clients or working with international teams virtually. The application and interview process 

Send your application today through our application portal and attach:



CV


Cover Letter


University Transcripts/grades (including GPA in a 5 grade scale)



Upload all files under "Upload Resume/CV". Please note that all of these documents are required for a complete application. Only complete applications are reviewed.  

Please indicate which office(s) you are applying to in your application.   The screening and selection process is ongoing. If your application proceeds to the next step, you will receive an invitation to two tests that aim to measure your analytical ability.  We look forward to receiving your application!  Equal is greater than - Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from a diverse group of backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity! 


Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
B3 Business Transformation söker engagerade och drivna Data Engineers som vill vara en del av ett härligt och kompetent team och som vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss.

Vi på B3 Business Transformation stärker våra kunders digitala konkurrenskraft genom att vara datadrivna i sina processer, analyser och vid beslutsfattande. Med vår kompetens inom Advanced Analytics, Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence i kombination med stor affärsförståelse leder vi våra kunder in i ett datadrivet arbetssätt och möjliggör utveckling av nya digitala initiativ och etablering av moderna arbetssätt. Så varför inte ta chansen att bli en del av ett kompetent team som drivs av utveckling, samhörighet och energi.

Om rollen:

Som konsult hos oss ges du möjligheter till intressanta uppdrag hos en mängd olika spännande kunder. Att du har förmågan att skapa relationer och på ett prestigelöst sätt samarbeta i team tror vi är avgörande för att du ska lyckas i ditt uppdrag. Som Data Engineer är ditt fokus att designa, modellera, utveckla datalager och integrationsflöden från en eller flera olika källsystem, för att lagra data i strukturerade eller semistrukturerade datakällor. Du arbetar självständigt eller tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor, där ni formar en effektiv informationslösning vilket är en förutsättning för att skapa ett bestående datadrivet arbetssätt hos kunden.

Ett CV säger inte allt men vi ser att du har följande kvalifikationer:


Du har minst 3 års erfarenhet från att ha arbetat som Data Engineer.
Du har erfarenhet av flera olika moderna ramverk och utvecklarverktyg för t.ex ETL/ELT-flöden, Databaser, Data Warehouse, DataLake, Datamodellering och DevOps.
Du har erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i en eller flera molnplattformar – Azure, AWS, GCP.
Det är meriterade om du har arbetat som konsult
Du arbetar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


Vi erbjuder:


Attraktiv lönemodell.
Goda förutsättningar för flexibla arbetstider.
Möjligheter att gå relevanta utbildningar och ta attraktiva certifikat.
Multi cloud-satsning.
Bra ramavtal och en stark säljorganisation som skapar förutsättningar för många spännande uppdrag.
En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning. Läs mer här


B3 Business Transformation är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Således kan vi erbjuda det bästa av två världar. Styrkan hos ett stort börsnoterat bolag i kombination med den härliga samhörigheten som ett mindre bolag erbjuder.

Vi är även stolta över att vi vann priset som ”Årets Karriärföretag” 2022 och kom på tredje plats som Sveriges bästa bolag enligt ”Great Place to Work 2021”. Vi tror att det beror på vår energi, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och våra erfarenheter som vi gärna delar med oss av. En central del av energiskapandet är vår unika wellness-satsning Team B3. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra, presterar bra och vill vara engagerade kollegor och goda medmänniskor. Det är även viktigt för oss att ge dig möjligheter till att löpande utbilda och certifiera dig inom relevanta områden för att du ska känna att du utvecklas och ökar ditt marknadsvärde.

De som jobbar kvar hos oss efter många år pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetstider och utveckling. De talar även om stoltheten över att vara en del av ett bolag som inte bara levererar förstklassigt resultat till sina kunder utan även tar ansvar för samhället i stort bl.a. genom att vara partner till fina initiativ som Women in Tech, Changers Hub, Pink Programming m.fl.

Kontakt:

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, så ansök redan idag.

Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail, men har du någon fråga är du mer än välkommen att höra av dig till Talent Acquisition Partner marcus.krebs@b3.se
Show more

  • Du har erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i en eller flera molnplattformar – Azure, AWS, GCP.
  • Det är meriterade om du har arbetat som konsult
  • Du arbetar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.

Vi erbjuder:

  • Attraktiv lönemodell.
  • Goda förutsättningar för flexibla arbetstider.
  • Möjligheter att gå relevanta utbildningar och ta attraktiva certifikat.
  • Multi cloud-satsning.
  • Bra ramavtal och en stark säljorganisation som skapar förutsättningar för många spännande uppdrag.
  • En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning. Läs mer här

B3 Business Transformation är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Således kan vi erbjuda det bästa av två världar. Styrkan hos ett stort börsnoterat bolag i kombination med den härliga samhörigheten som ett mindre bolag erbjuder.

Vi är även stolta över att vi vann priset som ”Årets Karriärföretag” 2022 och kom på tredje plats som Sveriges bästa bolag enligt ”Great Place to Work 2021”. Vi tror att det beror på vår energi, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och våra erfarenheter som vi gärna delar med oss av. En central del av energiskapandet är vår unika wellness-satsning Team B3. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra, presterar bra och vill vara engagerade kollegor och goda medmänniskor. Det är även viktigt för oss att ge dig möjligheter till att löpande utbilda och certifiera dig inom relevanta områden för att du ska känna att du utvecklas och ökar ditt marknadsvärde.

De som jobbar kvar hos oss efter många år pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetstider och utveckling. De talar även om stoltheten över att vara en del av ett bolag som inte bara levererar förstklassigt resultat till sina kunder utan även tar ansvar för samhället i stort bl.a. genom att vara partner till fina initiativ som Women in Tech, Changers Hub, Pink Programming m.fl.

Kontakt:

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, så ansök redan idag.

Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail, men har du någon fråga är du mer än välkommen att höra av dig till Talent Acquisition Partner marcus.krebs@b3.se

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a hands on Data Engineer experienced with integration and cloud data stack like Snowflake, Looker, dbt.


Experience in data modeling to design and optimize data structures ensuring efficient storage, scalability and performance.
You will work closely with Solution designer to make sure you build an effective and sustainable solution.
As part of the team you will take part in the development cycle (requirement analysis, design, development, test, deployment, hand over).
Design, build and integrate data from various sources.
Write complex data queries and create data infrastructure in a simple and efficient matter.
Design and develop analytics dashboard solutions for the business to make it possible to e.g. increase decision accuracy and improve process efficiency.
Work closely with our business stakeholders with a strong focus on aligning with business and technical requirements
At least a Bachelor's within Computer Science or comparable field and you have at least 5 years' experience in software development
Experience in designing, implementing, and supporting enterprise-scale ETL / ELT pipelines
Well familiar with AWS, Looker, K8S, and datawarehouse solutions
Strong in stakeholder management
Self-motivated and self-going
Show more

Title: Data Engineer to tech company in Stockholm
Description:
we're on a quest to find a Data Engineer, someone as passionate as we are about making the world a happier place and enriching lives through the world of reading. Join our extraordinary team, and let's script a future where every day is a chapter of discovery, and every book is a key to a richer life.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

As a Data Engineer at our client you will work with keeping and developing the data drivenness of our client throughout the organization.

With a curious, innovative and analytical mindset and tech-savvy approach you will fuel our data-driven teams.

Together with the team you will be responsible for data services which means, data warehousing, ML/AI, data quality and enabling data insights. You will build and run data pipelines, data warehouses, data frameworks and leverage ML/AI. We believe that you enjoy working autonomously in close collaboration with the cross-functional teams and other stakeholders.

You will be a part of an amazing team and be at the core of understanding a consumer subscription service - always with the continuous aspiration to increase reading! The position is based in Stockholm and you report to the companies COO.

Who are you…

We believe that you are currently working in a similar role at a fast-moving company. We believe that you would like to develop a thorough understanding of how consumers use our service and be part of delivering key insights. By using various development techniques, you will keep us in the forefront of creating the best customer experience as well as providing a great self-service data platform. We believe that you take pride in structuring, integrating and transforming data on a daily basis - you believe that data quality is key!

If you have ambitions (or experience!) of working with areas like ML and AI we would love to give you a platform to show your practice! You thrive working in a dynamic and unpretentious environment where you take great responsibility for our product and your team!

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

• We believe you have, for the field, relevant educational background

• We believe you have around 4 years of experience from working within the field

• We believe you have experience from working with event-driven architecture (Kafka streams or similar)

• We believe that you are an expert in SQL and have worked with Java, Python and/or similar languages

• We believe that you have experience with cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS, GCP) and cloud data warehousing, preferably BigQuery or equivalent

• We believe that you have experience working with pipelines and data integration solutions with an ELT approach

• We believe that you have experience in operating, maintaining and ensuring quality of production grade software

We are looking forward to your application which should include a CV or LinkedIn profile.

Location- Stockholm




Show more

Title: Application Engineer - Data Center/OEM.
Description:
A successful Application Engineer posses excellent communication skills, industrial understanding, highly organized and can work independently. You will be responsible for generation and adapting Data Center Application Solutions to Industry/OEM customers to contribute continuous business growth.

This position requires frequent travel to customer sites, installation sites, and meetings.




Responsibilities




Work closely with the sales team to understand customers’ requirements and develop applicable solutions, to develop and present customized solutions proposals to various clients for their application needs
Act as a liaison between the sales team, product team, and technical team etc. to facilitate smooth communication and collaboration.
Conduct training sessions and technical workshops for customers and partners to enhance their understanding of our products.
Stay updated on industry trends, competitor products, and market demands to provide strategic insights and recommendations.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date customer database, and project documentation, including project plans, timelines, and deliverables. Generate regular reports on project status, and project contracts, highlighting key metrics and milestones.
Address inquiries and requests from team members regarding project details and status.
Highly responsive to customers, providing accurate, comprehensive and timely information
Support Global HQ and R&D departments for product development improvement with latest customer requirements and insights.
On occasion, travel to customer sites to install, commission, and configure products according to specifications and project requirements.
Other ad hoc tasks assigned by manager




Qualifications




University degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering.
3+ years working experience from similar role focusing on sectors such as Data Center or other related industries OEM, EPC or System Integrator.
Strong technical understanding of power transmission and distribution products or equipment.
Excellent written, verbal, presentation, negotiation, and public speaking skills in Swedish and English.
Advanced level of ability to use Microsoft Office products.
Work independently or with supervision and achieve established goals and objectives.
Strong technical aptitude and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to analyze and resolve complex technical problems.
Strong direct customer service experience.
Attention to detail, highly organized and effective time management skills.
Possess a results-oriented, proactive work ethic.
Ability to travel within Nordic Region with around 30% frequency.




What do we offer




A challenging job in which you can use your entrepreneurial spirit.
A nice international team that we are currently building.
Freedom.
A good salary.
An attractive bonus schemes.
A laptop & Mobile contract.
Good work-life balance.
The opportunity for personal development; Chint has growth ambitions, you can grow with them.
And finally: A great adventure helping us grow in the Nordic Regions!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot’s growth has been exponential - from a successful IPO to building out new teams, we never stop working hard to fulfill our mission to create better experiences for everyone through our platform. But to do that, we need data! That’s where Analytics comes in - you’ll enable us measure, uncover insights, and predict, to get data everywhere in Trustpilot. We’ve built a innovative analytics team that spans two continents and four cities - are you ready to join a fun, diverse global team?

As a Data Analyst at Trustpilot, you will collaborate with Trusties in our Commercial/Marketing or Trust teams and spend your time digging through our data to provide them with data-driven insights, as well as analytics and dashboards/reporting. You’re keen to ensure them use data to answer their toughest questions, and you can proactively identify areas that need a little data support. You’ll be an internal data consultant, with loads of amazing data in our data warehouse at your fingertips, working with analytical tools including BigQuery and Looker.

Commercial/Marketing

As a B2B company, understanding our customers’ journey from prospect to paid customer is key. In this role, you get to join a growing team of data analysts and work closely with our Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Operations teams. The team is responsible for all types of analyses to support our marketing and commercial efforts and strategy, from understanding which marketing campaigns work well, to mapping our customers’ journey through data and analysing the impact of our pricing initiatives.

Trust

A huge part of what we do at Trustpilot is Trust (it’s in the name!). We need to ensure that the content on our platform is real content from real people. That means eliminating scam and spam, and identifying fraudulent behaviour. We have several cross-functional teams devoted to Trust. You’ll be tightly aligned to their goals, supporting teams such as Content Integrity to discover fraudulent activity, andhelping data scientists assess their spam models.

What You’ll Be Doing


Delivering proficient analytics and insights to different parts of the business, through both workstream-focused initiatives and ad-hoc inquiries
Picking the right solution for the problem you’ve got, from your arsenal of analytical tools and methods
Working closely with the Commercial/Marketing or Trust teams to understand their data and their goals to deliver awesome solutions
Presenting and promoting your work to the wider business, to enable data-inform choices


Who You Are


Good knowledge of key analytical and statistical methodologies, such as model-based analyses (regression, clustering etc.), cohort analysis and A/B testing. as well as reporting best practices, leveraging BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau etc.)
Knowledge of reporting best practices and experience delivering actionable insights leveraging BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau etc.)
Experience in stakeholder and project management, with the knowledge to deliver results back to the business
Proficiency in R or Python, and awesome SQL skills
Familiarity with Airflow, DBT or similar tools used for building data pipelines
Advanced written and verbal communication skills


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.


Show more

Join us at the heart of trust.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be a part of the world’s leading jewelry company while putting your experience in technology into use? If yes, then we have an exciting opportunity for you! You will be part of our Marketing Analytics teams and work in an international organisation of can-do spirited, passionate, and performance-driven people. We value flexibility and informal working, where you are trusted to deliver and to focus on outcomes and business value.

About The Role

You will join the Marketing Analytics product line, within the AI & Innovation department in Data & Analytics. Our teams are working agile, and cross functional, consisting of engineers, data analysts and data visualization specialists. We work closely with the Marketing organization, but also within D&A to support other digital teams. You, as well as the other 2 data analysts, will be reporting to the Product Manager.

Your responsibilities will include:


Formulating and defining scope and objectives based on a thorough understanding of business needs and business processes.
Understanding the business implications of advanced analytics solutions and assisting in defining the solutions to support any future business requirements.
Executing advanced analytics projects and providing ad hoc analyses to the business as needed.
Designing, driving, and implementing analytics tools and ad hoc analyses. Engaging with users to understand & meet their analytics requirements.
Ensuring timely delivery of reports/analysis and proactively communicating delays/issues.
Ensuring data accuracy in each deliverable.
Providing support for business continuity of deliverables/analyses, and driving the usage and adoption of our new self-service analytical tool.



In order to succeed, we expect that you have:


3-5 years of relevant experience
Proficiency in data visualizations and dashboards.
Effective SQL skills.
Strong analytical skills.
Proficiency in querying and manipulating complex raw datasets for analysis.
Experience explaining technical concepts to varied audiences and experience translating business objectives into actionable analyses, with a focus on design thinking and user centric design
Sound knowledge & experience in business communication/ presentation skills and reporting  
Proven stakeholder management skills
BS Degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Information Technology, Finance or similar.
Passion for data science & AI, & having Python or Pyspark skills is a plus
Fluenncy in English, both spoken and written



Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora’s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.
Show more
