  • Ensuring data accuracy in each deliverable.
  • Providing support for business continuity of deliverables/analyses, and driving the usage and adoption of our new self-service analytical tool.


In order to succeed, we expect that you have:

  • 3-5 years of relevant experience
  • Proficiency in data visualizations and dashboards.
  • Effective SQL skills.
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Proficiency in querying and manipulating complex raw datasets for analysis.
  • Experience explaining technical concepts to varied audiences and experience translating business objectives into actionable analyses, with a focus on design thinking and user centric design
  • Sound knowledge & experience in business communication/ presentation skills and reporting  
  • Proven stakeholder management skills
  • BS Degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Information Technology, Finance or similar.
  • Passion for data science & AI, & having Python or Pyspark skills is a plus
  • Fluenncy in English, both spoken and written


Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora’s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 103 million registered users and 237,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 373+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1009.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with business leaders across various functional areas to inform how they measure success, how they use data to inform strategic decisions, and ensure they have the data visibility and tools they need to make progress on those strategies every day.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team member’s on their projects


Requirements


You have previous experience in an analytical role
You have a breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have experience managing multiple projects
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You are strongly proficient in SQL
You are strongly proficient in at least one BI/Data Visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 170+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst at Novo Nordisk Engineering
Place: Virum, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Does the idea of developing business-critical data solutions excite you? Do you thrive on building cloud-based BI solutions and developing reports in Power BI and Excel? Then you’ll fit right in!

What do we do at NNE?

We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and we design and build pharma facilities that are essential for millions of patients all over the world. Our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you are passionate about working for a noble cause on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.

About The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team of in our department for Financial Systems. As a team, we are developing and maintaining applications within the Finance Domain. Furthermore, you will be a part of the cross organizational ERP project.

As our new Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in developing business critical data solutions for NNE, as you will participate in building our cloud-based data reporting solution while also ensuring a smooth transition from our current reporting environment.

Location Virum Department Financial Systems

Experience 2 years Employment Type Full Time

How You Might Spend Your Days

As Data Analyst, you’ll:


Participate in project activities building a cloud-based Business Intelligence (BI) solution that integrates with Dynamics 365 ERP system
Develop new reports in the cloud, together with a dedicated and strong team of data analysts
In general build, change, and deploy reports in Power BI or Excel based on user Interpret and reconcile data from multiple sources
Handle ad hoc data requests from end users
Provide backend support for other applications within the Finance domain, e.g., Planning and Consolidation application as well as other systems



Who You Are

We care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy, is what impacts the results we achieve as a team. As a person, you have:


Excellent problem-solving and collaboration skills
A curious mindset and are a great team player
A strong understanding of business processes and the ability to translate user requirements into technical specifications
Agility and the ability to prioritize urgent tasks
Excitement to build on the NNE culture of innovation



The miles you’ve walked

In all positions there are some things that are needed, and others a bonus. We believe these qualifications are needed for you to do well in this role:


Prior experience working as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in data analysis, pivot tables, and complex formulas
Strong knowledge of SQL, Power BI and ETL development with ability to write and optimize queries for data extraction and manipulation
Familiarity with Azure Synapse Analytics and knowledge of Microsoft Fabric are an advantage
Bachelor’s degree in business, Computer science, Engineering, or related fields



If you do not check all the boxes, you are welcome to offer alternative experience that you think would be valuable in this role.

Why choose NNE?

We provide a range of perks and benefits tailored to enhance your overall experience. Some highlights include:


Vibrant and project-based work environment
Collaboration and innovation-based culture
True empowerment and flexible working conditions



Unleash your potential

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We are the epitome of a people business and, as such, we are dedicated to continuously developing our people. We do not expect you to know it all, and we recognize that a great onboarding experience is key. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

Deadline of application is October 26 th 2024.

Questions before applying? Please contact Cecilia Maunsbach +45 3077 4535.

At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. To maintain fairness, we request that you refrain from including a photo in your CV.

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ambitious, business savvy and passionate about data and analysis? Then we have a unique opportunity for you.




In the Kilroy Group, we have been on an ambitious mission to digitize our end-to-end customer experience across 6 brands, 5 business concepts, 8 markets and 400+ colleagues. In this position you will play a pivotal role in transforming all this data into actionable insights.




As our Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering data-driven insights and recommendations that can help optimize our strategic priorities and operational excellence. You will work closely with management and various business units to understand their needs and provide them with relevant and reliable reports, dashboards, and analyses. You will also ensure the quality and integrity of our data across source systems, promote a culture of data literacy and instill best practices across the organization. In this position you will get a network across functions, brands, and markets as you get to deep dive into the data and business processes behind our commercial performance across the organization. You will report to the COO.


Areas of responsibilities:
Reports & Dashboards:
Primary responsible for all non-financial reports that help steer our commercial priorities.
Joining financial and non-financial reporting where it adds value by creating business insights.
Complete a unified KPI reporting setup that combines our data sources, preferably in both a PowerBI reporting suite with drill down functionality as well as a slice and dice format accessible via power tools in Excel. We have data sitting in bespoke sales systems, in Salesforce, HR platform, email automation system, marketing platforms as well as survey tools for NPS and similar.
Reports and dashboards should cater to past performance, present operational efficiency, and forecast of future performance.
Collaborate with system analysts/product owners to ensure a unified approach to operational reporting, providing consistent insights across stakeholder groups in our organization.
Analysis & Actionable insights:
Primary responsible for proactive analysis and subsequent actionable insights to help drive commercial excellence, in close collaboration with both product owners and commercial managers.
"Daily go to person" for management when they need help with report creation, analysis, and validation of data on ad hoc analysis.
Data architecture:
Ensure that data for reporting can be ingested from multiple sources, can be transformed and triangulated to support reports and analyses.
Bring your input to the conversation on data management to jointly solve Master data management, i.e. identifying the necessary data for each system and specifying which system holds the master data, consult on the most suitable approach to data integration and storage systems, including plans on data maintenance. Work with relevant stakeholders across the organization to set the standards for governance to ensure high data discipline.







These words describe you well:
You are motivated by complexity and enjoy decomposing high-level information into actionable insights
Ability to communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner, both visually, verbally and in writing
Solid understanding of data warehousing, ETL and data modeling concepts and techniques
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and Power BI (in a PC driven and Microsoft based company)
Strong analytical skills, and attention to detail
Curiosity and enthusiasm for identifying patterns or insights, learning new skills, and understanding the data architecture of different tech platforms
A collaborative customer-oriented and commercial mindset, a proactive and flexible attitude
AI curiosity and interest is a plus
A Bachelor or Masters degree or equivalent in business, economics, statistics, computer science or a related field
3+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis or a similar role
Fluency in English is required
You are a team player with an ability to develop and sustain strong relationships with stakeholders across the business 

Next step

If you are excited about this opportunity and can see yourself add value in this position, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Please include your CV and cover letter in you application via the link below. 

We look forward to hearing from you!




Kilroy International A/S - About us

Kilroy International A/S heads up a group of leading European companies, specializing in adventurous travel experiences, group trips, study trips, study abroad experiences and student benefits. Our legacy is built on the notion that travelling is the best way to widen your horizon and break down cultural barriers, and this is still what drives our mission today. The Kilroy Group operates in eight markets (Belgium, Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, Sweden, the Netherlands and the UK) and in 2023 we employed over 400 people and generated a total turnover of more than DKK 1,4 billion.

The Group comprises of seven brands BENNS, Education Abroad, ISIC, Jysk Rejsebureau, KILROY, MyPlanet and Winberg Travel. Our shared units’ office, Kilroy International, supports all brands across the Group with services such as marketing, products, finance, fulfilment, HR, in-house system development and operations. Situated in the heart of Copenhagen, our office fosters an international collegial environment and a dynamic atmosphere. We are approx. 80 colleagues representing more than 15 different nationalities. We pride ourselves with an informal atmosphere and a culture where good ideas are worth investigating and unexpected outcomes are opportunities to learn from.

Read more about us on www.kilroygroup.net

Title: Marketing Insights Analyst
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us to enable the business to generate value through the provision of analytics and insights based on customer data and data from external sources. You will work with data across the full customer journey, from awareness through the sales funnel to loyalty.

As our new Marketing Insights Analyst, you will join Analytics and Insights team in Kongens Lyngby, Denmark. The two key components of this role will be reporting (via Power BI dashboards) and ad hoc, complex Marketing analytics.

Key Responsibilities



Possess contextual business knowledge and functional domain expertise in the advertising, social, CRM and media space, using data, analytics, and insights to add revenue and business-impacting value via audience selection and behavioural engagement.
Develop actionable insights and recommendations for optimization.
Provide insights to aid in the planning of campaigns across marketing channels.
Create and deliver routine reports and as well as ad-hoc and in-depth analytics.
Forecast the potential uplift of campaign activations, optimizations, and new features to aid prioritization.
Build on the foundations of automated data collection, processing, and reporting.
Improve our techniques, processes and quality assurance of implemented analytics tracking and reporting.
Build relationships with data architects, analytics and data teams that manage tools and data sets, with the aim of creating meaningful data integrations that reveal more powerful insights.
Work closely with colleagues, partners and agencies of differing analytics expertise to ensure proposed solutions meet desired reporting requirements.



What You Bring

We are seeking someone who is enthusiastic about data and who are continuously learning and bringing new developments to the team.

Additionally, you bring:



Minimum 8 years of experience in analytics, data science, or quantitative insights in an enterprise setting.
Minimum 3 years working with marketing analytics data.
Master’s Degree or Ph.D. in Data Science, Operations Research, Psychometrics, Marketing Science, Finance, (Bio)Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or another quantitative field.
Advanced skills in writing in Python/R (modelling) and SQL/Spark (data).
Proficiency in evaluating the big picture and solve business problems rather than focusing solely on metrics.
Prior experience with at least one of the following methodologies: media mix modelling, multitouch attribution, customer lifetime value, customer loyalty and churn, behaviour-based segmentation, incrementality modelling, propensity modelling or targeting.
Prior expereince working with Pandas, StatsModels, PYMC, TensorFlow, Pytorch, Spark/ML, sklearn, NumPy and related packages will be advantageous but is not a requirement.
Convincing drive for results and intellectual curiosity; must be a self-starter.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects at once without sacrificing quality.
Excellent written and verbal and communication skills in English.



What We Offer

As part of our Analytics & Insights function, you will join a team of 5 experts based in Lyngby, Denmark. Analytics & Insights is part of our wider marketing function where there will be daily collaboration, but this role will also interact with many other customer-facing functions across the business.

With approximately 1.000 employees, Bang & Olufsen is an agile company that gives room for individual flexibility and decision-making. Our hierarchy is flat, and our communication is open and trustworthy. We believe in mutual respect and with a unique pool of people coming from +55 countries we aim to build a more inclusive workplace to grow as professionals and as a company and remain innovative.

Compensation: Competitive salary and benefits package.

Location: Kongens Lyngby, Denmark.

Start date: As soon as possible.

Travel: Approx. 5%

How To Apply

Submit your CV and application in English by pressing the ‘Apply’ button. Applications are assessed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than 20th October 2024.

At Bang & Olufsen, we believe in equal opportunities for all. We encourage applicants to focus on their qualifications, skills, and experience when submitting their CVs. Please refrain from including personal information such as photographs, marital status, or gender. Our hiring decisions are based solely on merit, and we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal chance to succeed. If you see yourself in the position and believe you have the potential to support build B&O's future, even if you don't meet all the requirements, we sincerely encourage you to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact our TA Consultant, Nina Vestergaard on NVES@bang-olufsen.dk . Please do not send your CV and application to this e-mail directly as these will not be taken into consideration.

Read more about our recruitment process and explore your career opportunities within Bang & Olufsen here .

Bang & Olufsen has for more than 99 years developed luxury audio products that change moods and inspire minds. With offices in Denmark (headquartered in Struer) and the rest of the world, Bang & Olufsen is determined to create products that push the boundaries of audio technology. To this day, every product is still characterized by the unique combination of beautiful sound, timeless design and unrivalled craftmanship.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Tester
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are You Ready to Work With the Latest Technologies?

We are looking to grow our IT team with a skilled and experienced Business Intelligence (BI) Tester. If you appreciate working with the latest technologies, wish to improve your career, and participate in continuous learning and training initiatives, it could be you who we are looking for.

Who Are We?

The RiskPoint Group is a global Managing General Underwriter (MGU) providing best-in-class insurance solutions backed by the insurance companies we act on behalf of.

You will become part of our new, small team of highly skilled BI professionals, who together holds many years of experience in insurance data. Our BI team is part of our growing IT team, which is part of our Finance & Operations department. In this role, you will be working with other IT colleagues in both Denmark and the UK as well as colleagues from other departments.

We operate in an agile organization with close cross-border cooperation across all business lines. And our organizational structure is flat, leaving many opportunities for all employees to make a difference, take responsibility, excel, and grow.

About The Position

As our new BI Tester, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our data pipelines, reports, and dashboards.

This is an onsite role based either in our Copenhagen office or in our London office, with the option to work remotely if approved by your manager. Occasional domestic and international travel may be required.

You will report to our CTO, who is located in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Your key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:


Design, develop, and maintain comprehensive test plans and test cases for BI solutions
Perform regression testing to ensure existing functionalities are not affected by new developments
Conduct behavioral testing to validate the system’s behavior against expected outcomes
Write and execute tests in dbt (data build tool) to ensure data transformations are accurate and reliable
Collaborate with BI developers, data engineers, and analysts to understand requirements and validate solutions
Identify, document, and track defects and issues through to resolution
Ensure data quality and integrity across all data platforms
Participate in continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies to continuously improve our BI testing capabilities


Please note that current residency in either Denmark or the UK with work and residency permit needs to be in place before applying.

A Great Match for Us

The ideal candidate will have completed a degree that provides a solid foundation in computer science principles, programming, data structures, and database management. That could be, for example, a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.

You must have worked professionally for 2-5 years in roles involving BI testing, demonstrating the ability to handle job-specific challenges and deliver results in a business environment.

Moreover you need to have:


Extensive experience conducting regression tests to ensure new code changes do not adversely affect existing functionalities.
Conducted behavioral tests to validate that the system behaves as expected under various conditions.
Hands-on experience in designing and executing test plans for ETL pipelines, ensuring data is accurately extracted from various sources, correctly transformed into the required format, and reliably loaded into data warehouses or other destinations.
Hands-on experience using dbt (data build tool) to write and execute tests for data transformations, proving your ability to ensure data quality and accuracy.
High proficiency level in SQL and the capability of writing complex queries to validate data integrity and accuracy.
Practical experience in validating data models and ensuring data consistency across the data warehouse.
Experience validating data visualizations and dashboards to ensure you provide accurate and actionable insights.
Demonstrated the ability to identify and solve complex data-related problems, ensuring high data quality and reliability.


It is furthermore a requirement that you have a proven track record of working effectively in team settings, communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions.

To be successful in this role, we expect you to have excellent problem solving skills, strong communication skills, and always pay attention to the details.

Although not required, we prefer you are:


Experienced in validating and testing big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Iceberg), ensuring data processing and transformations are performed correctly and efficiently across large-scale datasets.
Familiar with DevOps methodologies and tools, such as CI/CD pipelines, version control systems, and infrastructure automation, indicating your ability to contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.


Interested in the Position?

We are looking forward to receiving your resume and a motivational letter of application for this position. Please use the form below.

We hope to see your application before October 31, 2024, but have patience and can wait for the perfect match. Interviews will be held successively.

For more information about the position, contact CTO, Zubair Sabir, at *protected email*. Note that we do not accept applications via e-mail, please use the form below.

About The RiskPoint Group

The RiskPoint Group is one of Europe’s largest Managing General Underwriters (MGUs), providing best in class insurance solutions to businesses and their advisors globally. The RiskPoint Group operates as RiskPoint in Europe and Asia and RP Underwriting in the rest of the world.

With 250+ employees and 15 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific, the RiskPoint Group employs expert underwriting and specialized, in-house claims teams within Accident & Health, Transactional Risk, Property & Construction, Renewable Energy, Offshore Upstream, and Liabilities, including Financial Lines, Cyber, and Casualty.

The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd’s of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. The RiskPoint Group core values are: trust, openness & honesty, respect & tolerance, drive & dedication as well as being part of a winning team in a competitive environment.
Show more

The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd’s of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. Title: BI Consultant
Description:
About Us And The Job

At Bolia, things are always in motion, and we have high ambitions for our IT solutions to create the absolute best experiences for our customers, colleagues, and partners. We are heavily data-driven in our decision-making, and we have a growing need for outstanding BI reports and analyses across the entire business. This includes anything from store personnel to back-office functions, and towards Bolia's management group.

In short, we have a wealth of data at Bolia, and we want to make even more and better use of it than we do today! To strengthen this effort, we are looking for a new colleague to act as an internal BI consultant with a primary focus on the PowerBI platform. In this role, you will have a broad interface across all departments at Bolia, and you will also collaborate with our many external partners in developing new reporting solutions.

Your Responsibilities

The tasks in the job can be numerous and varied, but examples of tasks include:


Drive and participate in the development of reporting solutions in both PowerBI and Excel to enhance BOLIA's ability to make the right decisions.
Ownership of Bolia’s BI platform, primarily focused on the back-end. However, you will also be expected to assist colleagues with front-end tasks as needed.
Play a crucial role in the ongoing project of taking our current on-prem BI platform to the next level using Microsoft Fabri (you will work closely with external partners).
Data processing and refinement on SQL Server, to enhance data quality and analysis capabilities.
Provide second-level support for BI backend-related tasks.
Vendor management and follow-up on deliveries from external partners.
Participate in various business projects in collaboration with all departments at BOLIA, especially your colleagues in the Business Development team, which primarily handles the front-end work.
Participate in a new BI Center of Excellence in BOLIA to align on the BI efforts.
Stay up to date with new possibilities and trends within your area, such as AI and Microsoft CoPilot for PowerBI.


BOLIA and our IT solutions are undergoing rapid development, providing you with the opportunity to make a significant impact from day one by setting the agenda within the BI area. You will be taking over from the current BI Consultant, who is moving on to new opportunities, and you will become a key figure at our headquarters, collaborating closely with many of your colleagues. Additionally, we will continue to engage external partners to assist with backend BI tasks, who will also serve as your professional sparring partners.

Your Skills

We value personality and practical experience far more than educational background, which can vary. The more of the following points you can check off, the better.


You have a desire to inspire and demonstrate the possibilities of using data and Business Intelligence to make better decisions.
You are a master of PowerBI and data modeling, which is your home court, and have experience in other parts of Microsoft's BI suite.
You have experience with SQL, SSIS and ETL-processes in general.
You have experience with data sources like Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O and/or CE or similar.
You are self-driven but still a team player and eager to acquire new knowledge.
You have a great business understanding and can maintain an overview while also having an eye for detail.
You always deliver high quality in what you do.


Good to Know


We are in the heart of Aarhus, close to the train station, in what are arguably the most beautiful office spaces in Denmark!
There is a very active staff association that regularly organizes all sorts of events from parties to knitting clubs.
We have a young working environment with an amazing unity across all departments.
We are part of the Lars Larsen Group, which means that as an employee, you will receive a good staff discount in all Lars Larsen Group companies, including furniture, restaurants, and spa stays.
Our workday is flexible with possibilities for sometimes working from home.


How To Apply

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so we recommend that you send your application and CV as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Head of IT Applications, Kasper Poulsen, on kpo@bolia.com.

All inquiries will be treated confidentially.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) - Data Analytics & Insights Team
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Country

Denmark

Job Family

Client Solutions

Our Mission

At Consumer Panel Services GfK, our mission is clear: to provide key information on who buys what, where, how much, how often, and most importantly, why (or why not). We take pride in delivering high-quality, uninterrupted data, expert consultancy, and unparalleled expertise to empower our clients to deliver superior customer experiences at every stage of the shopper journey.

Job Description

We have one goal: To support our customers in strengthening their market position.

In continuous consumer research, we collect and analyse the purchasing behaviour of consumers within the FMCG market. This gives us important information about which purchasing decisions consumers make and how behaviour changes over time. In this way, the consumer panel explains how and when markets and brands change. For them we make predictions for tomorrow so that they can make the right decisions today. Through our data analysis, we filter out and structure the relevant information, we ensure that our customers from trade and industry recognize the right signals that are for them in the flood of data and thus support e.g. marketing strategies.

The (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) sits within our Data Analytics & Insights Team in Consumer Panel Services and is responsible for research design, project proposal as well as ad hoc data analysis and reporting for our Nordic clients. The (Junior) Specialist is able to take a large amount of data, structure it according to it each case, and built up a relevant storyline for the client in collaboration with the responsible consultants for each client. Reporting to our Director Data Analytics & Insights Team based in Germany the (Junior) Specialist will have an autonomous approach to their work but also benefit from close collaboration with consulting, commercial and operational colleagues across the Nordic region.

Purpose of the Role

The purpose of the role may vary depending on the candidate scope but ideally to include:


Define adequate analyses design
Structuring data and build up a relevant storyline
Responsible for providing all types of insight deliveries to clients
Build solutions colleges and clients can benefit from
Constantly improving our data and add process quality
Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes
If applicable: is responsible for project management tasks
Proactive and independent problem solving (finds solutions for business problems), not just execution of tasks!


Key Activities

Research Design & Proposal Development


Create and adapt adequate research design
Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes


Analysis and reporting


Create in-depth client studies for reporting purposes or detailed customer requests
Analyse data and trends in data using various tools in order to generate insights for the client
Develop presentation charts and client reports with corresponding insights which reply the client’s questions; utilization of fact-based-consultancy
Promote automation processes and develops efficient ways to create client deliverables such as excel tables, PPT slides and internal programmes you will learn to use


Client Management


To some extent have client interaction and act as an expert in the analysis we make for them
Being in charge of delivering monthly/quarterly/annual reports to clients


Requirements


Reading and understanding either Danish or Swedish
English language skills - B2 min.
An advantage with skills in Excel and PPT
The motivation to take a large amount of data, structure it and make a universe for many kinds of clients
Eager to learn our internal data analysis programmes
Ideally able to work in our Copenhagen office. Otherwise work from our Stockholm office as an alternative


We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) – Data Analytics & Insights Team

Job beskrivelse

Vi har ét mål: At støtte vores kunder i at styrke deres markedsposition.

I løbende forbrugerundersøgelser indsamler og analyserer vi forbrugernes købsadfærd inden for FMCG-markedet. Dette giver os vigtig information om, hvilke købsbeslutninger forbrugerne træffer, og hvordan adfærd ændrer sig over tid. På den måde identificerer forbrugerpanelet, hvordan og hvornår markeder og brands ændrer sig. For kunderne laver vi morgendagens forudsigelser, så de kan træffe de rigtige beslutninger i dag.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) for Market Research sidder i vores Data Analytics & Insights Team i vores Consumer Panel afdeling og er ansvarlig for analysedesign, projektforslag samt ad hoc dataanalyse og rapportering for vores nordiske kunder. (Junior) Specialist er i stand til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den efter det hver case og opbygge en relevant storyline for kunden i samarbejde med de ansvarlige konsulenter for hver kunde. Ved at rapportere til vores Director Data Analytics & Insights Team baseret i Tyskland vil projektlederen have en selvstændig tilgang til deres arbejde, men også drage fordel af et tæt samarbejde med konsulent-, kommercielle og operationelle kolleger på tværs af Norden.

Rollens formål

Formålet med rollen kan variere afhængigt af kandidatens faglige baggrund, men ideelt set omfatte:

Research Design


Definere passende analysedesign
Strukturere data og opbygge en relevant storyline
Ansvarlig for at levere alle typer indsigtsleverancer til kunder
Konstant forbedring af vores data og proceskvalitet
Give input til design af statistiske analyser og opsætning af effektive processer
Hvis relevant: er ansvarlig for projektledelsesopgaver
Proaktiv og selvstændig problemløsning (finder løsninger på forretningsproblemer), ikke kun udførelse af opgaver!


Analyse og rapportering


Udarbejde dybdegående kundeundersøgelser til rapporteringsformål eller detaljerede kundeønsker
Analysere data og trends i data ved hjælp af forskellige værktøjer med henblik på at generere indsigt til kunden
Udvikle præsentationsdiagrammer og klientrapporter med tilsvarende indsigt, som besvarer kundens spørgsmål; udnyttelse af faktabaseret rådgivning
Fremme automatiseringsprocesser og udvikle effektive måder til at skabe kundeleverancer såsom excel-tabeller, PPT-dias og interne programmer, du vil lære at bruge


Kundestyring


Til en vis grad have klientinteraktion og fungere som ekspert i den analyse, vi laver for dem
At stå for levering af månedlige/kvartalsvise/årlige rapporter til kunder


Krav


At læse og forstå enten dansk eller svensk
Engelsk sprogkundskaber - B2 min.
En fordel med kompetencer i Excel og PPT
Motivationen til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den og lave et univers til mange forskellige kunder
Klar på at lære vores interne dataanalyseprogrammer
Ideelt set i stand til at arbejde på vores kontor i København. Ellers arbejde fra vores Stockholm-kontor som et alternativ


Vi er en etisk og ærlig virksomhed, der er engageret i sine kunder og medarbejdere. Vi er stolte af at være en inkluderende arbejdsplads for alle og er forpligtet til lige muligheder i beskæftigelsen, som fokuserer på, at alle vores medarbejdere når deres fulde potentiale. Hos CPS arbejder vi sammen med vores kolleger, men tilbyder en fleksibel arbejdstilgang, herunder at dele vores tid mellem kontor & fjernarbejde samt mulighed for at flekse vores arbejdstid omkring teamets kernetimer.

Vi tilbyder et spændende arbejdsmiljø, der bringer mennesker sammen. Vi tilskynder til en iværksætterånd og innovativ ånd. Vi gør brug af de nyeste digitale teknologier. Vi søger en god kollega, som tager imod udfordringer og skaber løsninger.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal employment opportunity, focusing on all of our employees reaching their full potential.

We respect and value every employee regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, personality, experience, culture, faith, socio-economic status, or physical or mental disabilities.

We endorse the core principles and rights set forth in the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights and the Social Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, promoting the universal values of human dignity, freedom, equality, and solidarity.

Learn more about who we are and everything we do on: https://www.gfk-cps.com/about-gfk-cps

HTML:
Country

Denmark

Job Family

Client Solutions

Our Mission

At Consumer Panel Services GfK, our mission is clear: to provide key information on who buys what, where, how much, how often, and most importantly, why (or why not). We take pride in delivering high-quality, uninterrupted data, expert consultancy, and unparalleled expertise to empower our clients to deliver superior customer experiences at every stage of the shopper journey.

Job Description

We have one goal: To support our customers in strengthening their market position.

In continuous consumer research, we collect and analyse the purchasing behaviour of consumers within the FMCG market. This gives us important information about which purchasing decisions consumers make and how behaviour changes over time. In this way, the consumer panel explains how and when markets and brands change. For them we make predictions for tomorrow so that they can make the right decisions today. Through our data analysis, we filter out and structure the relevant information, we ensure that our customers from trade and industry recognize the right signals that are for them in the flood of data and thus support e.g. marketing strategies.

The (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) sits within our Data Analytics & Insights Team in Consumer Panel Services and is responsible for research design, project proposal as well as ad hoc data analysis and reporting for our Nordic clients. The (Junior) Specialist is able to take a large amount of data, structure it according to it each case, and built up a relevant storyline for the client in collaboration with the responsible consultants for each client. Reporting to our Director Data Analytics & Insights Team based in Germany the (Junior) Specialist will have an autonomous approach to their work but also benefit from close collaboration with consulting, commercial and operational colleagues across the Nordic region.

Purpose of the Role

The purpose of the role may vary depending on the candidate scope but ideally to include:

  • Define adequate analyses design
  • Structuring data and build up a relevant storyline
  • Responsible for providing all types of insight deliveries to clients
  • Build solutions colleges and clients can benefit from
  • Constantly improving our data and add process quality
  • Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes
  • If applicable: is responsible for project management tasks
  • Proactive and independent problem solving (finds solutions for business problems), not just execution of tasks!

Key Activities

Research Design & Proposal Development

  • Create and adapt adequate research design
  • Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes

Analysis and reporting

  • Create in-depth client studies for reporting purposes or detailed customer requests
  • Analyse data and trends in data using various tools in order to generate insights for the client
  • Develop presentation charts and client reports with corresponding insights which reply the client’s questions; utilization of fact-based-consultancy
  • Promote automation processes and develops efficient ways to create client deliverables such as excel tables, PPT slides and internal programmes you will learn to use

Client Management

  • To some extent have client interaction and act as an expert in the analysis we make for them
  • Being in charge of delivering monthly/quarterly/annual reports to clients

Requirements

  • Reading and understanding either Danish or Swedish
  • English language skills - B2 min.
  • An advantage with skills in Excel and PPT
  • The motivation to take a large amount of data, structure it and make a universe for many kinds of clients
  • Eager to learn our internal data analysis programmes
  • Ideally able to work in our Copenhagen office. Otherwise work from our Stockholm office as an alternative

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) – Data Analytics & Insights Team

Job beskrivelse

Vi har ét mål: At støtte vores kunder i at styrke deres markedsposition.

I løbende forbrugerundersøgelser indsamler og analyserer vi forbrugernes købsadfærd inden for FMCG-markedet. Dette giver os vigtig information om, hvilke købsbeslutninger forbrugerne træffer, og hvordan adfærd ændrer sig over tid. På den måde identificerer forbrugerpanelet, hvordan og hvornår markeder og brands ændrer sig. For kunderne laver vi morgendagens forudsigelser, så de kan træffe de rigtige beslutninger i dag.

  • Strukturere data og opbygge en relevant storyline
  • Ansvarlig for at levere alle typer indsigtsleverancer til kunder
  • Konstant forbedring af vores data og proceskvalitet
  • Give input til design af statistiske analyser og opsætning af effektive processer
  • Hvis relevant: er ansvarlig for projektledelsesopgaver
  • Proaktiv og selvstændig problemløsning (finder løsninger på forretningsproblemer), ikke kun udførelse af opgaver!

Analyse og rapportering

  • Udarbejde dybdegående kundeundersøgelser til rapporteringsformål eller detaljerede kundeønsker
  • Analysere data og trends i data ved hjælp af forskellige værktøjer med henblik på at generere indsigt til kunden
  • Udvikle præsentationsdiagrammer og klientrapporter med tilsvarende indsigt, som besvarer kundens spørgsmål; udnyttelse af faktabaseret rådgivning
  • Fremme automatiseringsprocesser og udvikle effektive måder til at skabe kundeleverancer såsom excel-tabeller, PPT-dias og interne programmer, du vil lære at bruge

Kundestyring

  • At stå for levering af månedlige/kvartalsvise/årlige rapporter til kunder

Krav

  • En fordel med kompetencer i Excel og PPT
  • Motivationen til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den og lave et univers til mange forskellige kunder
  • Klar på at lære vores interne dataanalyseprogrammer
  • Ideelt set i stand til at arbejde på vores kontor i København. Ellers arbejde fra vores Stockholm-kontor som et alternativ

Title: Sr. Data Analysis and Insights Professional
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive impactful environmental data analysis and insights? Are you keen to play an essential role in supporting Novo Nordisk's ambitious sustainability targets? If so, then you might be our new Data Analysis and Insight Professional working as part of the Environmental Data & Digitalisation Team, Analytics & Reporting in Product Supply Sustainability (PSS) at Novo Nordisk.

The Position
We are offering an exciting and challenging role where you will contribute to the strategic priorities of Product Supply Sustainability by enabling data-driven environmental decisions, providing analysis and insights for high-impact decisions. You will utilize your analysis system knowledge to secure data quality and establish data connections across systems, enabling robust analysis - often developed in close collaboration with colleagues.

Your Main Responsibilities



Establish analysis and data driven insights via data collected across systems and departments
Build and visualise data in Power BI and Power App dashboards
Support data quality and governance in the team as well as data dependencies outside team
Close collaboration and alignment with team members as well as colleagues in the organisation like environmental partners, production sites representatives, system owners etc.
Translate organisational needs from production sites and corporate functions into data products




Qualifications

You are creative and innovative of mind with a profound data and digital mindset. You are result-oriented and possess the ability to foster collaboration across areas. You thrive in a high pace environment, where things are anything but a steady state and where little guidance may be available.

Additionally, the ideal candidate should have the following skills and experience:



Experience in Power BI, Power APP, Alteryx or similar tools, and preferable API solution knowledge
Strong capabilities in connecting data points across systems, analyzing and effectively visualize and present data to influence decisions
Sustainability knowledge and experience, particularly in energy, water, waste, or plastic initiatives
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with fluency in English
Relevant master's degree in or related to IT, engineering, or business administration




As a person we are looking for someone who enjoys being part of a fast-paced homogenous team and at the same time can work with a high degree of independence. You are not afraid of trying new ways and walking into uncharted territory. You are proactive and a team player taking pride in collaborating with other people in the organisation. Finally, you have an outgoing personality and strong communication skills, both oral and written English, the ideal candidate excels at building and maintaining strong relationships with a wide range of stakeholders across different functions to drive change and reduce environmental impact.

Thus, if you are passionate about driving environmental data analysis and insights, and possess the skills and experience we are seeking, we would love to hear from you.

About The Department

The Environmental Data & Digitalisaiton team is part of the Analytics & Reporting department anchored within the Product Supply Sustainability area of Novo Nordisk. The area is on the journey of reducing the environmental footprint by using data and digital solutions to support decisions. The Analytics & Reporting team is among other things responsible for environmental production data and the reporting of energy, water, waste and CO2 emissions from Production and distribution as well as developing state-of-the-art digital solutions to support therein. The team consists of highly skilled data analysts and scientists as well as business analysts who drive data analysis, insights and intelligence on the environmental sustainability agenda for our expanding production sites. The Team is currently consisting of 20 people in HQ Bagsværd and 2 colleagues in Bangalore, India. We work closely with stakeholders across Novo Nordisk to implement the Circular for Zero environmental strategy into Novo Nordisk production thus supporting our overall ambition to have zero environmental impact.

Working in Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we have been changing diabetes since 1923. If you are ready to strengthen our position as an innovative pioneer and respected industry leader, we encourage you to join us to make the most of your talent.

Contact
For further information, please contact Karoline Borum Svarrer, Manager in Environmental Data & Digitalisation (+45) 30 75 51 38

Deadline
October 23th 2024

Please note that we will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. We will close this recruitment when we have found the right candidate.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV

Title: Data Analyst/Power BI specialist within Marketing Operations
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
#WeAreUR and we continuously redefine automation

Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., has a simple mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere .

Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. And with 75,000+ cobots already installed worldwide, we’re already making a difference. Working towards our vision gives us endless opportunities to learn, grow, innovate, and solve problems together as we bring our technology to companies of all sizes all over the world.

The Marketing Operations function in UR Marketing is relatively new. Hence you will join an ambitious and business critical team, who are on an exciting growth journey – keen to improve and support the business and UR marketing even better.

The team supports the global and regional marketing teams on everything related to budgets, targets, performance, and extensive reporting. We work with a substantial list of KPIs and metrics, and it is imperative that you understand the logic and formulas behind. Business acumen is vital in this role, as you will actively help us discover trends and insights that will guide our decisions.

You will be responsible for producing new as well as elevating and maintaining insightful, interactive dashboards and visual reports giving our marketing leaders instant performance insight and drive data-driven decision-making processes within the organization.

Apart from working with the marketing organization, we work closely with the Sales Operations team and the Strategic Data team ensuring our ability to report seamlessly across the commercial organization and spot opportunities and challenges internally and in the market. Hence, you will need to not only work with the numbers but also understand and articulate the story they tell.

Responsibilities


Extract and transform data from various sources e.g. SalesForce to prepare it for analysis.
Develop and maintain dashboards to showcase marketing performance metrics across product areas, pipeline, conversion rates, and value split by e.g. industry, geography, time etc.
Generate Power BI reports with seamless integration into Excel for comprehensive data analysis and reporting.
Build Predictive Analysis reports to enable us to use our data proactively to build stronger plans
Build forecast model


We are driven by honesty and act with integrity - #WhoAreUR


5-8 years of experience from marketing analytics or related field
Proficiency in Power BI, SalesForce and Excel, with hands-on experience in developing marketing dashboards.
Key Competencies includes development of user-friendly dashboards and reports, data visualization and analysis, automating routine tasks and processes, creating data models and implementing best practices
Ability to work independently to identify and visualize relevant KPIs that align with business objectives. Demonstrated ability to gather, structure, and analyze complex data for reporting and visualization purposes
Skilled in collaborating with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to deliver data-driven insights and actionable recommendations
Strong analytical skills to gather and structure data effectively for reporting purposes and look for trends in the numbers we can use to scale our business.
Must be based in Denmark and be fluid in spoken and written English


We collaborate - it´s in our DNA

Join Universal Robots, the ground-breaking technology company, and help us on our mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Shaping next year’s innovations. Moving a fast-growing industry forward. Building a truly global career. You can do it all here .

At Universal Robots we are a diverse group of bright, ambitious people working at the forefront of collaborative robotics. Through our agility, resilience, and entrepreneurial approach, we are taking our innovative robot products into more markets and regions than ever before.

We employ around 1000 people in offices across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia – and we’re growing all the time. So, if you’re looking to build your career working with some of the best talent from all over the world, we want to get in touch with you!

Please apply using the link. We invite candidates into the recruitment process on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Title: Specialist, Data Analyst
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Management | Full-Time | Information Technology

Are you enthusiastic about using data to ensure performance and improvement?

Vestas' Continuous Improvement and Analytics (CI&A) team seeks a Specialist Data Analyst to contribute to significant advancements in quality. If you’re excited about turning complex data into clear insights and enjoy working in a global team, this role will give you the platform to influence meaningful change across the organization.

The Continuous Improvement and Analytics team (CI&A) is part of the global Vestas Quality organization.

The team’s vision is to engage all Vestas colleagues, ensuring that Vestas consistently meets and exceeds break-through quality performance results. Key elements of this vision are


Providing ways of working for continuous improvement and quality analytics
Execution of high impact opportunities that deliver tangible results
Demonstrating how to use data to guide choices


Responsibilities


Providing simple, scalable and uniform ways of working for continuous improvement and quality analytics
Building a deep, data-based understanding of Vestas quality issues, risks and opportunities
Deploying and animating a performance management approach and culture to: (1) see deviations to target early; (2) resolve problems to the root cause and (3) to replicate learnings and prevent recurrence
Deepening the understanding of (dashboard) performance and trends
Proposing high-impact initiatives, priorities and smart targets
Realizing goals through the pursuit of impactful opportunities and providing leadership and assistance for strategic quality initiatives
Partnering across Vestas to build and animate a global community of continuous improvement and quality analytics leaders and equip them with the required competences
Acknowledging commendable procedures being implemented and improving upon established premier techniques for Operational Effectiveness, Design for Quality, Collaborative Involvement, and Transformation Guidance


Qualifications


An engineering or similar technical background, master of science or master of business administration, or other relevant experience
Possesses a certified black belt or similar qualification, with experience in effectively initiating positive changes
Proven achievements in Quality, Manufacturing, R&D, or Supply Chain, underpinned by 5-10 years of experience in modern Lean/Six Sigma organizations
Proficient in working with teams, you have well-developed communication and relationship-building skills, enabling clear dialogues with a wide range of contributors within the organizational structure
Proficient in people management and adept at facilitating change, notably through mentoring, guiding, encouraging, and advancing the professional growth of employees)
Capable of self-motivated and imaginative work, recognizing areas that require project enhancement
High ethical standards and integrity are "must haves"


Competencies


Solid, demonstrated analytical skills. Experience with several tools like Excel, SQL, PowerBI, Spotfire and Minitab, as well as scripting languages like Python or Matlab. Familiarity with Cloud Frontiers technologies, including Dataiku, Databricks, and Snowflake, is regarded as beneficial
Ability to mentor, coach and guide experts, managers & senior leaders on root cause analysis, improvement solutions & building business case
Good at building a network and establishing partnerships
Committed to realizing significant and verifiable progress with a focus on tangible outcomes
Agile and able to simplify complex problems into simple logical milestones
Proficient in English and adept at both verbal and written exchanges


What We Offer

As a specialist you will hold a key position in the well-established global Continuous Improvement and Analytics team. Your contributions significantly influence Vestas' performance. You will have the chance to collaborate intimately with our senior leadership and prepare them to be effective proponents of ongoing progress.

Additional Information

The primary work location is in Aarhus, Denmark.

To be considered for this role, you must apply online before October 13, 2024. We will review applications on an ongoing basis. We can withdraw from the job and reserve the right to do so at any time, including before the advertised closing date.

For more information, please get in touch with Jan Crielaard, Head of Global Continuous Improvement and Analytics, at +4527871597.

BEWARE – RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.
Show more
HTML:
Management | Full-Time | Information Technology

Are you enthusiastic about using data to ensure performance and improvement?

Vestas' Continuous Improvement and Analytics (CI&A) team seeks a Specialist Data Analyst to contribute to significant advancements in quality. If you’re excited about turning complex data into clear insights and enjoy working in a global team, this role will give you the platform to influence meaningful change across the organization.

The Continuous Improvement and Analytics team (CI&A) is part of the global Vestas Quality organization.

The team’s vision is to engage all Vestas colleagues, ensuring that Vestas consistently meets and exceeds break-through quality performance results. Key elements of this vision are

  • Providing ways of working for continuous improvement and quality analytics
  • Execution of high impact opportunities that deliver tangible results
  • Demonstrating how to use data to guide choices

Responsibilities

  • Providing simple, scalable and uniform ways of working for continuous improvement and quality analytics
  • Building a deep, data-based understanding of Vestas quality issues, risks and opportunities
  • Deploying and animating a performance management approach and culture to: (1) see deviations to target early; (2) resolve problems to the root cause and (3) to replicate learnings and prevent recurrence
  • Deepening the understanding of (dashboard) performance and trends
  • Proposing high-impact initiatives, priorities and smart targets
  • Realizing goals through the pursuit of impactful opportunities and providing leadership and assistance for strategic quality initiatives
  • Partnering across Vestas to build and animate a global community of continuous improvement and quality analytics leaders and equip them with the required competences
  • Acknowledging commendable procedures being implemented and improving upon established premier techniques for Operational Effectiveness, Design for Quality, Collaborative Involvement, and Transformation Guidance

Qualifications

  • An engineering or similar technical background, master of science or master of business administration, or other relevant experience
  • Possesses a certified black belt or similar qualification, with experience in effectively initiating positive changes
  • Proven achievements in Quality, Manufacturing, R&D, or Supply Chain, underpinned by 5-10 years of experience in modern Lean/Six Sigma organizations
  • Proficient in working with teams, you have well-developed communication and relationship-building skills, enabling clear dialogues with a wide range of contributors within the organizational structure
  • Proficient in people management and adept at facilitating change, notably through mentoring, guiding, encouraging, and advancing the professional growth of employees)
  • Capable of self-motivated and imaginative work, recognizing areas that require project enhancement
  • High ethical standards and integrity are "must haves"

Competencies

  • Solid, demonstrated analytical skills. Experience with several tools like Excel, SQL, PowerBI, Spotfire and Minitab, as well as scripting languages like Python or Matlab. Familiarity with Cloud Frontiers technologies, including Dataiku, Databricks, and Snowflake, is regarded as beneficial
  • Ability to mentor, coach and guide experts, managers & senior leaders on root cause analysis, improvement solutions & building business case
  • Good at building a network and establishing partnerships
  • Committed to realizing significant and verifiable progress with a focus on tangible outcomes
  • Agile and able to simplify complex problems into simple logical milestones
  • Proficient in English and adept at both verbal and written exchanges

What We Offer

As a specialist you will hold a key position in the well-established global Continuous Improvement and Analytics team. Your contributions significantly influence Vestas' performance. You will have the chance to collaborate intimately with our senior leadership and prepare them to be effective proponents of ongoing progress.

Additional Information

The primary work location is in Aarhus, Denmark.

To be considered for this role, you must apply online before October 13, 2024. We will review applications on an ongoing basis. We can withdraw from the job and reserve the right to do so at any time, including before the advertised closing date.

For more information, please get in touch with Jan Crielaard, Head of Global Continuous Improvement and Analytics, at +4527871597.

Title: BI & Data Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du arbejde i Danmarks førende mobilitetsvirksomhed med HB Care og Dantaxi som to stærke brands, og hvor datadrevne beslutninger er i fokus og skal være fundamentet for al forretning? Interesserer du dig for at sætte data og indsigter i spil med henblik på at optimere og understøtte en forretning, og vil du gøre det i tæt dialog med interessenter på tværs af forretning og i ledelse? Og har du lyst til at arbejde med front-end Power BI opgaver og back-end MS Azure opgaver, direkte og gennem eksterne leverandører? Så skal du læse videre.




Du bliver Moove Groups ’go-to-person’ inden for BI & Data og rapporterer direkte til chefen for IT & Digital. Når du ønsker dyb faglig sparring, så har du dygtige kollegaer i IT samt erfarne BI specialister eksternt hos forskellige leverandører, så du bliver derfor godt understøttet og har muligheden for faglig og teknisk udvikling.




Om jobbet

Moove Group har et stort potentiale for at bruge data som grundlag for beslutninger og styring af deres drift. Der er en transformation i gang mhp. at skifte centrale IT-systemer, hvilket åbner op for at optimere og tilpasse datastrukturer og governance, og her spiller du en vigtig rolle i relation til at definere fremtidens måde at arbejde med data.




Dit arbejde foregår i spændingsfeltet mellem data og forretning, og hvor du leverer ’end-to-end’ Power BI-løsninger. Udover selv at lave front-end løsninger, så er du også opgavestiller og kontakt til eksterne samarbejdspartnere, som bidrager til datadrevne beslutninger på tværs af Moove Group. Dine primære arbejdsopgaver inkluderer:




Opbygge, vedligeholde og optimere Power BI-rapporter for at understøtte datadrevne beslutninger i organisationen.
Samarbejde med interne og eksterne interessenter for at forstå deres behov, og hvordan de bedst kan opfyldes gennem diverse løsninger.
Bidrage til data governance og kvalitetssikring af valide data.
Drive forankring og brug af rapporter i organisationen.
Yde support til og træne Power BI-brugere samt understøtte ledelsen i deres forretningsindsigt og beslutninger.




Om profilen

Vi leder efter dig, der både trives med at udvikle front-end løsninger i Power BI og kan arbejde med back-end løsninger i MS Azure og Moove Groups on-prem data warehouse – og som kan arbejde både selvstændigt og i samarbejde med eksterne leverandører.




Vi forestiller os, at du har en akademisk baggrund inden for IT eller tilsvarende. Det betyder knap så meget, om du er nyuddannet eller har 3-5 års erfaring – opgaverne kan skræddersyes til at passe til dit erfaringsniveau og ambitioner. Det vigtigste er, at du har indgående kendskab til Power BI og gerne har haft berøring med MS Azure.




Som person er du nysgerrig, initiativrig og handlingsorienteret. Du trives med en dynamisk hverdag, hvor opgaverne er forskellige, men hvor de alle bliver løst med højt engagement og kvalitet. Det fordrer derfor også, at du er proaktiv, selvmotiverende, selvstændig og er god til at prioritere og planlægge dine opgaver.




Hvorfor du skal vælge Moove Group

Moove Group er en engageret, uformel og tillidsbaseret arbejdsplads, som er præget af fokus på at skabe værdi for forretningen. Du bliver del af et godt team, der står for en bred vifte af opgaver indenfor udvikling, drift og support, hvor de hver dag tænker kreativt og løsningsorienteret i udviklingen af det fremtidige IT-landskab – og der er fokus på at have det sjovt sammen undervejs.




Mange af medarbejderne synes også, at det er ekstra motiverende, at der i disse år investeres i nye innovative systemer, som understøtter automatisering, digitalisering og optimering af forretningen og biler og bussers driftssystemer.




Arbejdsstedet bliver i nye lokaler tæt ved Bagsværd station, hvor der altid er friskbrygget kaffe, en lækker frokostordning og et godt socialt miljø, der byder på alt fra fredagsbar til kunstklub. Og vigtigst af alt… en masse sjove, søde og dygtige kollegaer.




Kontaktinformation

For mere information er du velkommen til at kontakte Jakob Schmidt-Hansen fra Hudson Nordic på mail js@hudsonnordic.com eller på telefon 31 21 07 12.

Show more

Kontaktinformation
