Title: Data Engineer
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer to Build Big Data Platform for Autorola




Are you interested in data and cloud computing, and would you like to work with big data? Are you ready to take ownership of your own platform project to help us build our new data platform from scratch? Then we want to hear from you!




The Position

Reporting to the Head of Data Science in our Business Unit, Indicata, you will play a central role in building our new Big Data Platform. The platform will support the business unit, but it will also be connected to the rest of Autorola to ensure that, over time, we can collaborate with the entire organization. You will collaborate closely with our IT department, focusing on building a data platform that adheres to best practices and benefits our customers by delivering data, analytics, and reporting products to help them improve their business and assist their customers.




Working with the Indicata Data Science team, you will develop data pipelines to transform raw data sources into cleansed datasets. These datasets will be enriched with advanced analytics and data science features, ultimately being presented to end-users and customers via Excel or Power BI. It is part of the team’s DNA that customers are willing to pay for what we do. That is how we understand value generation, and even though you will not be working directly with or for customers, it is important that you are motivated by being so close to the business.




Key Responsibilities

Develop & Maintain: Work with our DevSecOps IT architect to build and sustain data layers and logic on AWS and Databricks.
Govern DevOps: Ensure adherence to DevOps principles for data scientists and business users.
Expertise in SQL: Act as the subject matter expert for our Indicata SQL data warehouse.
Monitor Data Quality: Create metrics to ensure data integrity.
Manage Pipelines: Set up and maintain data extraction pipelines for customers.
Project Involvement: Participate in meetings to scope and report on projects. Take ownership of the project, working independently while effectively navigating a complex stakeholder landscape.
Code Review: Refine data science code for production readiness.




Qualifications

Experience: Ideally 2-3 years of experience in, software development, or computer science. Experience with databases, business intelligence or similar is desirable but not a requirement.
Cloud Expertise: Proficiency with AWS or Azure, API Scraping, SQL, Data Lakes, Git, and Cloud Computing Services.
Coding Proficiency: Ability to write and program production-ready code.
Data Modeling: Knowledge of R and Python for data modeling, and Spark for Big Data Computing.
Language Skills: Professional proficiency in English.




What we offer

You will get the opportunity to work on cutting-edge solutions for some of the strongest brands in the automotive industry. We are a fast-growing and established company with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. A close collaboration with the rest of the team is important, and therefore expect you to be able to meet in at the office physically but working from home occasionally is a possibility.




You will be working closely with five colleagues in the Indicata Data Science Team, which consists of a team lead, two data scientists, two data analysts, a remote business intelligence manager, and a student assistant. Besides, you will be collaborating with our forecasting team, our product team and the rest of Indicata.




We have an open-office environment, which is characterized by an informal and easygoing communicative culture. Our headquarters are located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A 5000 Odense C.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as get the chance to participate in the company’s social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and we like to end the week in our Friday bar.




For more information regarding the job, you are welcome to contact Kasper Christensen, Head of Data at kkc@indicata.com or Bjarke Matthiassen, HR Consultant at bhm@autorola.com.




Start date

By agreement

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis.

________________________________________________________________________________

Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions for professional used car and fleet management. Autorola Group is divided into three global business units:

Autorola Marketplace: a wide range of online auctions for European and global vehicle vendors.
Autorola Solutions: customized solutions to fleet owners covering the specific needs in OEM, bank, and leasing segments all over the world.
Indicata: is a global leader in providing business intelligence and market insights software, specifically designed for dealer groups, fleet owners and OEMs in the automotive industry. Our platform empowers businesses with real-time data analytics to optimize vehicle inventory management, pricing strategies, and market performance. With a presence in over 17 countries, we are driving innovation in used vehicle operations across Europe and beyond.




We work like a matrix organization, where each business unit has their own dedicated product line, designing, developing, and maintaining software solutions.

You can read much more about us at www.autorolagroup.com, www.autocom.dk, www.indicata.dk,

autorolasolutions.com, https://www.linkedin.com/company/autorolagroup

Show more

Title: BI-Specialist with a finance background
Place: Vejle Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du træt af rutinemæssige månedsafslutninger i økonomiafdelingen?

IFACT A/S søger lige nu erfarne økonomiprofiler til vores Team af Business Intelligence Specialister. Så sidder du i dag i en rolle som Financial controller, Business controller, Regnskabs- eller Økonomichef, kan vi tilbyde dig en alternativ karrierevej med fuld fart på. Her slipper du af med de kedelige og rutineprægede månedsafslutninger, hvor resultatet altid er den samme kedelige månedsrapport leveret i Excel. Som BI Specialist vil du lære at arbejde med den nyeste BI-teknologi, der i kombination med din økonomiske og forretningsmæssige forståelse, vil gøre dig i stand til at automatisere genereringen af nøgletal til mange forskellige virksomheder – hver dag.

 

Vi giver din kompetenceudvikling epo og opgraderer dig til en mere nutidig og digital udgave af dig selv, hvor Microsoft Power BI bliver dit nye foretrukne våben.

 

Inden længe vil du få alle roserne, når kunderne bliver præsenteret for dine fede og brugervenlige BI-rapporter, for der sker virkelig noget, når folk for første gang ser deres data i en dynamisk og grafisk stærk BI-rapport.

 

Vi tilbyder en fuldtidsstilling med en fast månedsløn og pension, der matcher dine kompetencer og erfaring.

 

Din rolle

Du vil inden for relativt kort tid få en helt central rolle i vores team, hvor din primære opgave bliver at gennemskue kundernes forskellige datakilder for derefter at designe og opbygge skræddersyede BI-rapporter til deres brugere. 




I takt med din stigende selvstændighed holder du kunden i hånden fra onboarding til løbende support og videreudvikling af deres BI-løsning på vores platform. Derigennem får du dyb indsigt i virksomhedens nøgletal og datakilder. Du skal på samme tid formå at afkode kundens behov og opbygge en effektiv, logisk og struktureret teknisk løsning. Med andre ord "spitze EDB".

 

Du kommer til at sidde sammen med vores team på hovedkontoret i Vejle, hvor de mere erfarne BI Specialister glæder sig til at opgradere dig.

 

Baggrund og kvalifikationer

Du har mindst 5 års erfaring med økonomirapportering, hvor du har formået at hjælpe din organisation med værdiskabende ledelsesrapportering samt sparring.

 

Vi er helt med på, at du endnu ikke er fuldt kørende på BI-værktøjerne, men til gengæld er du sikkert superbruger i Excel herunder Pivot-tabeller og avancerede formler. Hos IFACT laver vi datamodeller i MS Azure SSAS med Visual Studio og selve rapporterne i MS Power BI.

 

Du har grundlæggende interesse for kundens virksomhed, og dermed behov, i relation til nøgletal og dataanalyser. Interessen og forståelsen gør dig i stand til, at skræddersy BI-rapporter efter kundens behov.

 

Du er udadvendt og kommunikativ i forhold til dine kollegaer og byder proaktivt ind med egen erfaring og løsningsforslag på problemer og udfordringer.

 

Du har en kreativ og kunstnerisk side, du bringer i spil, så kunderne får en wauw-oplevelse, når de ser deres BI-rapporter. Vi vil selv føle os stolte af vores løsninger, også når det kræver mange flere timer, end vi lige havde regnet med.

 

Du formår at holde fokus på en enkelt opgave, selvom du har mange forskelligartede opgaver i gang. Vi har et til tider hektisk miljø, med mange forskelligartede opgaver for forskellige kunder.

 

Vi glæder os til at høre fra DIG!

Du kan blive vores nye BI Specialist ved at give Henrik et kald på 41 83 14 80 eller sende os dit CV til hel@ifact.dk - du behøver ikke skrive nogen ansøgning.

 

Om IFACT

"IFACT A/S er en selvstændig virksomhed under Jansson Gruppen A/S. Vi har udviklet en ”State of the Art” BI-platform i Azure samt kompetencer til udvikling af de fedeste BI-rapporter og dashboards. Vores kunder abonnerer på en komplet BI-løsning, som vi driver og videreudvikler i tæt samarbejde med kunderne. Det kalder vi "BI as a service”. Det betyder også, at vi IKKE er en klassisk konsulentforretning med overdrevet fokus på udlastning af vores konsulenter.

 

Vi er en lille, men dedikeret, startup-organisation, der har alle fordele ved at indgå i en større koncern, og vi vokser hurtigt🚀. Vores mission er at gøre BI tilgængeligt for de virksomheder, der ikke selv har kræfter til at etablere og drive en BI-løsning. Vores promise er, at vi tager et stort medansvar for kundens ultimative succes med BI."

Show more
HTML:
Er du træt af rutinemæssige månedsafslutninger i økonomiafdelingen?

IFACT A/S søger lige nu erfarne økonomiprofiler til vores Team af Business Intelligence Specialister. Så sidder du i dag i en rolle som Financial controller, Business controller, Regnskabs- eller Økonomichef, kan vi tilbyde dig en alternativ karrierevej med fuld fart på. Her slipper du af med de kedelige og rutineprægede månedsafslutninger, hvor resultatet altid er den samme kedelige månedsrapport leveret i Excel. Som BI Specialist vil du lære at arbejde med den nyeste BI-teknologi, der i kombination med din økonomiske og forretningsmæssige forståelse, vil gøre dig i stand til at automatisere genereringen af nøgletal til mange forskellige virksomheder – hver dag.

 

Vi giver din kompetenceudvikling epo og opgraderer dig til en mere nutidig og digital udgave af dig selv, hvor Microsoft Power BI bliver dit nye foretrukne våben.

 

Inden længe vil du få alle roserne, når kunderne bliver præsenteret for dine fede og brugervenlige BI-rapporter, for der sker virkelig noget, når folk for første gang ser deres data i en dynamisk og grafisk stærk BI-rapport.

 

Vi tilbyder en fuldtidsstilling med en fast månedsløn og pension, der matcher dine kompetencer og erfaring.

 

Din rolle

Du vil inden for relativt kort tid få en helt central rolle i vores team, hvor din primære opgave bliver at gennemskue kundernes forskellige datakilder for derefter at designe og opbygge skræddersyede BI-rapporter til deres brugere. 


I takt med din stigende selvstændighed holder du kunden i hånden fra onboarding til løbende support og videreudvikling af deres BI-løsning på vores platform. Derigennem får du dyb indsigt i virksomhedens nøgletal og datakilder. Du skal på samme tid formå at afkode kundens behov og opbygge en effektiv, logisk og struktureret teknisk løsning. Title: Operations Analyst & Power BI developer
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a proactive professional with a passion for business intelligence and operations? Do you want to develop creative analytics solutions that drive operational success? As an Operations Analyst and Power BI Developer, you'll collaborate with diverse, cross-functional teams, shaping the future of business intelligence for operations while growing your expertise within a global organization. This is your opportunity to influence our operations through data-driven insights. Are you ready to embrace the challenge and grow with us?

Hempel, a global leader in coatings and paints, is seeking a talent to achieve Hempel’s Double Impact strategy. Join our Operations Intelligence team as an Operations Analyst and Power BI Developer to make a meaningful impact on how we use data to transform business processes. With a team committed to operational excellence, you’ll collaborate with diverse colleagues and stakeholders across multiple functions to create intuitive dashboards and actionable insights. This role will enable you to influence key decisions and optimize business processes, while also growing your own expertise in business intelligence.

Here’s some of the other things you can look forward to

As an Operations Analyst and Power BI Developer, you will play a pivotal role in globalizing and optimizing our BI tools and processes. You’ll support Operations and the CTO organization by developing and maintaining interactive Power BI reports, dashboards, and analytics solutions that empower data-driven decision-making and strategic initiatives.


Develop and implement Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs, ensuring they align with strategic goals.
Partner with Operations and CTO functions like Operations, Production, Logistics, Planning, Sustainability, Procurement, R&D, Quality, Solution Management and many more to address BI-related topics and contribute to key data quality improvement initiatives.
Provide analytical support and guidance, while enabling regional stakeholders to utilize BI tools effectively.
Drive continuous improvement by globalizing existing BI tools, streamlining reporting processes, and enhancing operational efficiency.
Act as a liaison between the Digital team and report owners to develop, optimize, and deliver solutions that enhance data accessibility and usage.
Support the training and development of stakeholders in using BI tools to promote a culture of data-driven decision-making.


What do you need to be successful in this role?


Experience with data modelling and visualization tools preferably in Power BI.
Experience in developing, implementing, and maintaining BI solutions.
Good communication skills and the ability to translate complex technical solutions into simple, understandable answers for non-technical users. Experience with user training and/or support on BI tools is a plus.
Previous experience in a role requiring collaboration with cross-functional teams to address BI-related topics.
Knowledge of SQL and its application in BI environments is a plus.
Proficiency in English
Proactive with strong communication skills, able to advise on BI topics and work independently across teams.
Collaborative team player, focused on achieving goals, sharing knowledge, and growing in the BI and analytics field.


Sounds like a match?

Welcome to apply! Click the ‘Apply for position’ button in the top-right corner and submit your application letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system. Final deadline for applications is 24 October 2024. For further information about the job, please contact Line Friis - lif@hempel.com

More About Hempel

At Hempel, you’re welcomed into a global community of 7,500 colleagues around the world. A workplace built on shared trust, mutual respect and support for each other. 

We’re on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players. Which is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed but expected. In return, you will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company – and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact. 

At Hempel, we are committed to ensuring everyone feels safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work.  We believe that inclusion is key to innovation, and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together. 

We are proud to be majority owned by the Hempel Foundation, dedicated to philanthropic activities, with our earnings contributing to many charitable initiatives every year. It means that when you work at Hempel, your hard work and dedication contribute to a greater cause, making your career matter twice. 

Learn more about Hempel and our commitments on hempel.com/career. 

Application due

2024-10-24

Seniority Level

Associate

Job Functions

Analyst

Industry

Chemicals

Across the globe, Hempel’s coatings solutions protect surfaces, structures and equipment. They extend asset lifetimes, reduce maintenance costs and make homes and workplaces safer and more colourful. Hempel was founded in Copenhagen, Denmark in 1915 by J.C. Hempel, and is solely owned by the Hempel Foundation, which not only ensures a solid economic base for the company, but is dedicated to making a difference in the world by empowering children to learn, supporting coatings science and sustaining biodiversity.
Show more

Title: Specialist, Data Analyst
Company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
Description:
Management | Full-Time | Information Technology

Are you enthusiastic about using data to ensure performance and improvement?

Vestas' Continuous Improvement and Analytics (CI&A) team seeks a Specialist Data Analyst to contribute to significant advancements in quality. If you're excited about turning complex data into clear insights and enjoy working in a global team, this role will give you the platform to influence meaningful change across the organization.

The Continuous Improvement and Analytics team (CI&A) is part of the global Vestas Quality organization.

The team's vision is to engage all Vestas colleagues, ensuring that Vestas consistently meets and exceeds break-through quality performance results. Key elements of this vision are


Providing ways of working for continuous improvement and quality analytics
Execution of high impact opportunities that deliver tangible results
Demonstrating how to use data to guide choices



Responsibilities


Providing simple, scalable and uniform ways of working for continuous improvement and quality analytics
Building a deep, data-based understanding of Vestas quality issues, risks and opportunities
Deploying and animating a performance management approach and culture to: (1) see deviations to target early; (2) resolve problems to the root cause and (3) to replicate learnings and prevent recurrence
Deepening the understanding of (dashboard) performance and trends
Proposing high-impact initiatives, priorities and smart targets
Realizing goals through the pursuit of impactful opportunities and providing leadership and assistance for strategic quality initiatives
Partnering across Vestas to build and animate a global community of continuous improvement and quality analytics leaders and equip them with the required competences
Acknowledging commendable procedures being implemented and improving upon established premier techniques for Operational Effectiveness, Design for Quality, Collaborative Involvement, and Transformation Guidance



Qualifications


An engineering or similar technical background, master of science or master of business administration, or other relevant experience
Possesses a certified black belt or similar qualification, with experience in effectively initiating positive changes
Proven achievements in Quality, Manufacturing, R&D, or Supply Chain, underpinned by 5-10 years of experience in modern Lean/Six Sigma organizations
Proficient in working with teams, you have well-developed communication and relationship-building skills, enabling clear dialogues with a wide range of contributors within the organizational structure
Proficient in people management and adept at facilitating change, notably through mentoring, guiding, encouraging, and advancing the professional growth of employees)
Capable of self-motivated and imaginative work, recognizing areas that require project enhancement
High ethical standards and integrity are "must haves"



Competencies


Solid, demonstrated analytical skills. Experience with several tools like Excel, SQL, PowerBI, Spotfire and Minitab, as well as scripting languages like Python or Matlab. Familiarity with Cloud Frontiers technologies, including Dataiku, Databricks, and Snowflake, is regarded as beneficial
Ability to mentor, coach and guide experts, managers & senior leaders on root cause analysis, improvement solutions & building business case
Good at building a network and establishing partnerships
Committed to realizing significant and verifiable progress with a focus on tangible outcomes
Agile and able to simplify complex problems into simple logical milestones
Proficient in English and adept at both verbal and written exchanges



What We Offer

As a specialist you will hold a key position in the well-established global Continuous Improvement and Analytics team. Your contributions significantly influence Vestas' performance. You will have the chance to collaborate intimately with our senior leadership and prepare them to be effective proponents of ongoing progress.

Additional Information

The primary work location is in Aarhus, Denmark.

To be considered for this role, you must apply online before October 13, 2024. We will review applications on an ongoing basis. We can withdraw from the job and reserve the right to do so at any time, including before the advertised closing date.

For more information, please get in touch with Jan Crielaard, Head of Global Continuous Improvement and Analytics, at +4527871597.

BEWARE - RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry's global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution - today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.
Show more

Title: Lead Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Redstone Commodity Search focus on offering 360° search solutions to the global commodities markets. With a competitive coverage of Trading Houses, Producers, Majors, Utilities, Merchants, Hedge Funds, Investment Banks and Brokerages; Redstone Commodity Search can confidently offer you an edge in today’s volatile market.




Redstone Commodity Search are working with an established Danish Commodities Trading House, in their search for a Lead Quantitative Researcher to join the growing Energy team.




Key Responsibilities / Tasks




Focus on EU power and Gas markets, seeking out new opportunities and trends.
Build models to power quantitative strategies.
Conduct research and statistical analysis.
Ensure compliance with regulations and reporting within the Energy Market.
Work with large data sets to predict and test statistical market patterns.
Role reports into the Director of Power Trading.




Key Qualifications / Experience




Having a broad understanding of international power and gas fundamentals.
Analytical mindset and strong ability to navigate the markets.
3+ years of relevant quantitative experience.
Master’s degree in finance, mathematics, economics, or a relevant field.
Strong attention to detail, and numerical accuracy.
Located in Denmark.

Show more

  • Ensure compliance with regulations and reporting within the Energy Market.
  • Work with large data sets to predict and test statistical market patterns.
  • Role reports into the Director of Power Trading.

  • Having a broad understanding of international power and gas fundamentals.
  • Analytical mindset and strong ability to navigate the markets.
  • 3+ years of relevant quantitative experience.
  • Master’s degree in finance, mathematics, economics, or a relevant field.
  • Strong attention to detail, and numerical accuracy.
  • Located in Denmark.

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
About us

At RavenPack, we are at the forefront of developing the next generation of generative AI tools for the finance industry and beyond. With 20 years of experience as a leading big data analytics provider for financial services, we empower our clients—including some of the world's most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers—to enhance returns, reduce risk, and increase efficiency by integrating public information into their models and workflows. Building on this expertise, we are now launching a new suite of GenAI and SaaS services, designed specifically for financial professionals.

Join a Company that is Powering the Future of Finance with AI

RavenPack has been recognized as the Best Alternative Data Provider by WatersTechnology and has been included in this year’s Top 100 Next Unicorns by Viva Technology. We recently launched Bigdata.com, a next-generation platform aimed at transforming financial decision-making.




Join RavenPack:

RavenPack is searching for a Quantitative Researcher / Data Scientist to join the Data Science - QIS Team at our Spanish headquarters. The role is based in Marbella. We offer a relocation package, competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.

As a Quant Researcher, you will be participating in the development of new agentic workflows utilizing our semantic search engine, showcasing the value of our RavenPack data for excavating insights.

The ability to communicate effectively in English both in writing and verbally is a must.

European legal working status is required.

We offer competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.




Your Responsibilities:

As a Quant Researcher, you will join the “Quantitative Investment Strategies (QIS) Team,” consisting of four quant researchers dedicated to feature engineering and developing systematic trading strategies. Your work will primarily involve data-driven research. You will create research workflows to enhance RavenPack’s reputation as a thought leader in the alternative data industry and present systematic workflows to conduct fundamental analysis. You will work jointly with the Head of QIS on practical use cases that demonstrate the value of RavenPack data. Additionally, your responsibilities will include:

Understanding accurately the fundamental implications of a topic on the macro and microeconomy.
Developing chain-of-thought agents to mimic a human professional analyst using our data, while discerning and filtering out irrelevant information.
Offering data-driven insights, engaging in research discussions, and presenting features to leading financial analysts, quantitative researchers and portfolio managers in the field.
Effectively communicating intricate analytical concepts to management in a clear and concise manner.




What We're Looking For:

A MSc in Data Analysis, Quantitative Finance, or Economics.
2+ years of relevant work experience as a data scientist or quantitative researcher, manipulating large and noisy alternative datasets for features engineering.
Outstanding analytical, critical-thinking, and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to conduct fundamental analysis in a systematic and quantitative way.
Demonstrated proficiency in Python, and in at least Dash, StreamLit, or RepLit web applications.
Strong enthusiasm for technology, and familiarity with big data technologies coupled with proficiency in language models is highly advantageous.




What's in it for you?

You will work with the latest technologies.
Our Headquarters is located in Marbella. Following the onboarding period, we offer a hybrid work model, allowing for up to 2 days remote per week.
Free Company shuttle bus from Malaga, Fuengirola, Riviera and Estepona.
You will have ownership of projects working in a collaborative environment where we will value your contribution.
You will work in an agile environment able to react quickly to changes with a fairly flat hierarchy.
As we encourage continuous learning, we will support your ongoing training.
Diversity is in our DNA! You will work in an international environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
For DI - Dansk Industri søger vi en Lead Data Engineer




Om stillingen




DI har en ambitiøs digital strategi, der skal bringe dem tættere på medlemmerne, understøtte vækst og sikre effektiv kommunikation og samarbejde på tværs. Som en del af dette og for at styrke Data & Automations Teamet søger DI en Lead Data Engineer.




Som Lead Data Engineer vil du være med til at opbygge en moderne dataplatform i DI. Du får mulighed for at være med i alle faser – fra analyse, design og udvikling til test, implementering og den måske vigtigste fase, forankringen i hverdagen. Du sætter den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis. Du kan skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.




Afdelingen har ansvaret for dataprocessering og dataløsninger og er godt i gang med at opbygge en dataplatform på Microsoft Azure stacken – startende med et datavarehus og en række analytiske løsninger. Afdelingen har til ansvar at få teknologierne til at tale sammen ved at automatisere og strømline datapipelines.




Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i afdelingen, som er Center of Excellence i forhold til dataplatformen. Du samarbejder tæt med forretningen om at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter gennem bl.a. selvbetjeningsløsninger. I den forbindelse vil du til dagligt være i tæt dialog med forretningen, hvor du også vil agere sparringspartner og indgå i dialog ift. opsætning af integration af data fra forskellige kildesystemer.




Derudover vil dit ansvarsområder bl.a være at:

Være drivende i at opbygge en moderne og mangfoldig dataplatform i DI.
Sætte den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis.
Skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.
Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i forhold til dataplatformen







Af arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. nævnes:

Udarbejde tekniske løsningsforslag, såvel som at estimere opgaver og effektivt kommunikere det til forretningen
Designe, udvikle og implementere dataløsninger, primært til data warehouset
Designe, udvikle og vedligeholde dataplatformen og data pipelines
Bidrage til at udvikle en langsigtet strategi for dataplatformen
Integrere data fra en række kilder, og opbygning af datamodeller
Bidrage til tekniske og forretningsmæssige afklaringer af løsninger
Deltage i udviklings- og projektopgaver i forbindelse med optimering af processer og systemer på tværs af DI.




Om dig

Den ideelle kandidat brænder for data og udvikling og tør udfordre status quo og flirte med cloud teknologi og data arkitektur. Du har fire til otte års erfaring fra en lignende stilling, evt. fra et konsulenthus eller en brancheorganisation, hvor du har haft hands-on erfaring med opbygning af data løsninger. Du har en relevant akademisk baggrund formentlig fra CBS, KU eller ITU med særlig fokus på data. Du er serviceorienteret, hjælpsom og kan være bindeled mellem forretningen og it-specialister. Vi ser gerne at du er fagligt nysgerrig i forhold til nye tendenser og udviklingen inden for datavidenskab, herunder data services i Azure. Derudover arbejder du struktureret og selvstændigt med et analytisk mindset og en metodisk tilgang.




Vi ser gerne at du besidder følgende kvalifikationer:

Ekspert i ETL processen, SQL programmering og datamart modellering iflg. Kimball
Solid erfaring med agil udvikling, gerne med afsæt i Git platformen
Gode kommunikationsevner på både dansk og engelsk




Det er en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du også har erfaring med:

T-SQL og SQL Server automation rammeværk generelt set
Analytiske applikationer, gerne Microsoft Power BI
Microsoft Azure dataplatform (Infrastruktur)
Azure data factory




Derudover er du en person, der tager ansvar for at kvaliteten, af det der leveres, er høj. Du er god til at sætte dig ind i komplekse og fagligt tunge opgaver. Du er resultatorienteret og har stor handlekraft. Det er også vigtigt, at du er vedholdende, også når det kommer til at udvikle dig selv fagligt og personligt, da teamet har stort fokus på det gode kollegaskab, samt at være gode samarbejdspartnere for hele huset. Det er altså vigtigt, at du er i stand til at danne dig en helhedsforståelse af hele DI. Endelig er du en person som har både hjerte og hjerne med på job og er enig med teamet i, at et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø er en nødvendig del af det at gå på arbejde.




Interesseret?

Så klik på linket herunder med det samme. Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt, og vi behandler kandidater løbende. Rekrutteringen faciliteres af vores rekrutteringspartner Kold+Partners. Har du spørgsmål eller brug for mere viden, er du velkommen til at kontakte Peter Kold (2989 0903).

Show more

Title: Data Management Engineer
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented, and communicative data management scientist to be responsible for managing the successful completion of tasks within Quality Control.

In this role you will support QC with Data tasks including visualizations, setup of data flows to track operational activities and identification of improvements in data handling across the department. This position requires a high degree of business acumen as well as process insight to drive, facilitate, and manage stakeholders across the entire QC business with authority and charisma.

In this position you will build up strong insights to our business, and a strong network both internally and with various stakeholders. You will serve as our go-to person in our Data & Visual Workflow hub within QC Projects and hold a key role in overseeing the task portfolio within the team.

Your task and responsibilities among others will be: 


Oversight of portfolio and task distribution within the Data & Visual Workflow hub.
Create and maintain dashboards in Tableau for Quality Control.
Optimize data flow from quality systems to create advanced views, e.g. through use of Power Apps/Power Automate.
Develop and manage models to identify trends and to measure KPIs.
Utilize tools as Alteryx and Tableau for data processing and visualization.



You will work closely together with internal stakeholders within FUJIFILM to ensure high quality and timely completion. You are expected to be service minded and creative in identifying solutions and mitigations for the business, however, you are also expected to be realistic and patient in explaining and guiding your stakeholders in what can be achieved.

The Data & Visual Workflow hub is part of QC Projects which is part of the QC organization. In QC we work in a busy and dynamic environment where we support biologics Drug Substance (DS) and Drug Product (DP) production as well as the global release of commercial products (DS/DP) for our global network of clients.

About Your Qualifications And Competences


Bachelor’s (BA) or Master’s Degree (MSc) in IT, Engineering, or any other relevant field.
Relevant QA IT or QC experience from the pharmaceutical industry.
Knowledge of GMP Quality Systems
As a person, you are organized with an attention to detail and still able to keep an overview.
You are service minded with excellent verbal and oral communication skills.
You have an ability to work independently and are self-driven.
You are a team player.
You thrive in a changing environment.
You enjoy multitasking.



Application

For questions, please do not hesitate to contact hiring manager Stephan Spence on +4541949796.

Working at FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies

We offer a competitive compensation package in a site/company growing rapidly, with many opportunities for individual growth, we also offer access to fitness and an attractive canteen.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

Our Manufacturing site in Hillerød, Denmark, brings together a complete range of expertise, capabilities and technologies to manufacture advanced biologics. As we continue to enhance and expand our capabilities, we are looking for people who share our passion, drive, and energy – what we call Genki – to join our team.

 

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

HTML:
We are looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented, and communicative data management scientist to be responsible for managing the successful completion of tasks within Quality Control.

In this role you will support QC with Data tasks including visualizations, setup of data flows to track operational activities and identification of improvements in data handling across the department. This position requires a high degree of business acumen as well as process insight to drive, facilitate, and manage stakeholders across the entire QC business with authority and charisma.

In this position you will build up strong insights to our business, and a strong network both internally and with various stakeholders. You will serve as our go-to person in our Data & Visual Workflow hub within QC Projects and hold a key role in overseeing the task portfolio within the team.

Your task and responsibilities among others will be: 

  • Oversight of portfolio and task distribution within the Data & Visual Workflow hub.
  • Create and maintain dashboards in Tableau for Quality Control.
  • Optimize data flow from quality systems to create advanced views, e.g. through use of Power Apps/Power Automate.
  • Develop and manage models to identify trends and to measure KPIs.
  • Utilize tools as Alteryx and Tableau for data processing and visualization.


You will work closely together with internal stakeholders within FUJIFILM to ensure high quality and timely completion. You are expected to be service minded and creative in identifying solutions and mitigations for the business, however, you are also expected to be realistic and patient in explaining and guiding your stakeholders in what can be achieved.

The Data & Visual Workflow hub is part of QC Projects which is part of the QC organization. In QC we work in a busy and dynamic environment where we support biologics Drug Substance (DS) and Drug Product (DP) production as well as the global release of commercial products (DS/DP) for our global network of clients.

About Your Qualifications And Competences

  • Bachelor’s (BA) or Master’s Degree (MSc) in IT, Engineering, or any other relevant field.
  • Relevant QA IT or QC experience from the pharmaceutical industry.
  • Knowledge of GMP Quality Systems
  • As a person, you are organized with an attention to detail and still able to keep an overview.
  • You are service minded with excellent verbal and oral communication skills.
  • You have an ability to work independently and are self-driven.
  • You are a team player.
  • You thrive in a changing environment.
  • You enjoy multitasking.


Application

For questions, please do not hesitate to contact hiring manager Stephan Spence on +4541949796.

Working at FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies

We offer a competitive compensation package in a site/company growing rapidly, with many opportunities for individual growth, we also offer access to fitness and an attractive canteen.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

Our Manufacturing site in Hillerød, Denmark, brings together a complete range of expertise, capabilities and technologies to manufacture advanced biologics. As we continue to enhance and expand our capabilities, we are looking for people who share our passion, drive, and energy – what we call Genki – to join our team.

 

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: Business-Focused Data Expert – Drive Innovation in Financial Data
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description



​​Are you ready to hit the ground running and dive into exciting challenges from day one? We're looking for a tech-savvy individual who thrives on learning by doing—someone who can seamlessly bridge development, architecture, business, and technology. Whether we call you a Data Engineer, Data Modeler, or Data Developer, the title isn’t what matters—the impact you’ll make is.


Join a Team of Senior Specialists


At SDC, you’ll be part of a diverse team of highly skilled senior specialists, located in both Denmark and Poland, all dedicated to our highly specialized work. Our team brings a range of backgrounds, personalities, and experiences, making it a dynamic and inclusive environment. We’re looking for someone who can add to this diversity with a unique skill set and a collaborative mindset.


Your Role: Making Data Work for Our Clients.


We are looking for a skilled Data Modeler/Data Analyst to join our team, working within our data warehouse build on a TeraData platform. The ideal candidate has experience in designing and optimizing data models, handling complex datasets, and building efficient ETL processes. You should be comfortable working with SQL, data visualization tools such as Power BI, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into actionable insights. Curiosity for data and a passion for uncovering trends to support decision-making are key traits for success in this role.


Hands-on Learning with Support From the start, you’ll be involved in projects with the support of a dedicated sidekick to help you navigate the complexities. You'll have the opportunity to develop solutions that make a real difference, and our team will be there to help you grow and thrive.


Your day-to-day tasks will involve:


Serving as a responsible specialist for specific areas of the Data Warehouse, efficient design for new requirements and ensuring operational stability.
Analyzing the needs of the customers, e.g. within regulatory reporting as COREP, ESG, TAX etc.)
Analysis of source systems, database design and data modelling.
POC on business requirements in tandem with our business analysists ensuring that technical solutions align with business objectives and requests.
SQL/ETL/Python development in Teradata and SAS DI.
Exposing data in customer-facing views, requiring data understanding and understanding of business processes.
Play an important role when it comes to the use of data in projects with our customers and across SDC as well as in our day-to-day maintenance tasks. Participate in customer meetings, contributing to agile SCRUM teams, and collaborating across departments in Denmark and Poland.

Your Skills and Background: We’re looking for a technical professional with a strong background in data analysis, data modeling, and data governance. You should have:


Practical experience with SQL/ETL or other programming languages such as SAS or Python
Familiarity with integration technologies, such as SAS DI.
Financial instruments and products
An understanding of how data flows work in large-scale environments, preferably in the financial or FinTech sectors.
The ability to communicate complex technical information to our business analysts as well as our customers and stakeholders.

Additional Advantages:


the ideal candidate should have a keen interest in exploring data, asking the right questions, and using it to solve complex problems.
Prior experience in the banking or financial sectors will be a huge plus.
someone who is proactive and no afraid to take the initiative in seeking new tasks and opportunities.
Someone who can take ownership of their new role.
self-driven

Ready for the Challenge? If you're excited about this opportunity, feel free to reach out to Team Leader Helene Bolvig-Hindsgaul at HHJ@sdc.dk or Mobile 2931 7499


You’re welcome to send us a motivated application, but we’re just as happy to receive your CV. Let’s discuss your passion for the role during the interview.




Additional Information



SDC is a full-service IT center that develops efficient banking solutions for millions of bank customers throughout the Nordic region. We were founded in 1963 when a number of small savings banks joined forces with the dream of economies of scale and digital bookkeeping. That dream still drives us. We call it "A great banking experience at a competitive price.”


In short, we offer small and medium-sized banks throughout the Nordic region efficient and user-friendly IT systems. This cross-Nordic collaboration makes us unique and enables us to work with economies of scale and share development costs.


We are more than 900 colleagues in offices in Ballerup, Warsaw, and Bergen.


Focusing on our internal values - "Winning Together", "Professional", and "Customer Oriented" - we work every day to meet the goals of the 2025 Strategy, "Execute Effective Banking".


You can find more information at www.sdc.dk

You can find more information at www.sdc.dk

Title: Student Worker, Business Intelligence
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a student worker with abilities within digital tools and data visualization to join Workplace Solutions & Operations (WS&O). WS&O has a broad and global responsibility for security, travel, maintenance of buildings & assets, workplace creations etc. across 14 countries and within both Offices and factories.

In your job as a student worker you will help us with our digital tools as well as with the structuring, visualization and communication of our performance. You will communicate with and work together with the global team to ensure the proper use of tools and development of our executive reporting.


Core Responsibilities





You will help colleagues globally with the use of our different digital tools.
You will help to drive data collection, aggregation, interpretation and visualization.
You will support in building dashboards and reports using PowerBI and other data visualization tools.
You will engage with colleagues globally to quantify and verify data accuracy to ensure communication to our main stakeholders is correct.
You will help to organize and build a data hierarchy to ensure a robust reporting system.
You will potentially interact with our stakeholders to help broaden the reach of our executive reporting.




Play your part in our team succeeding

You will work within a dynamic and ambitious setting where we want to professionalize and become more data driven as an organization. You will work closely with the global team to setup our tools the right way, to support change management based on implementation of new tools, to build a holistic view using data visualization that allows WS&O to make informed decisions on our performance as well as communicate the progress. You are expected to work independently with Power BI to prepare the data visualization reports with sparring support from the central team.

Do you have what it takes?

It is a prerequisite that you are enrolled in an educational institution during your employment as a student worker. Further





You are a student in an IT or business Intelligence related field or equivalent working experience.
You are able to work mostly independently with tools and data sources and producing the relevant outputs.
You are curious by nature and eager to learn more.
You are able to work up till 15 hours per week in the team.
Advanced competency with Data visualization tools i.e., Power BI.
Familiarity with Monday.com is a plus.
Familiarity with the Microsoft Power Platform is a plus (Automate and Power Apps).
Python/R/SQL a plus but not necessary.
Attention to details.
Familiarity with data modelling and principles regarding data architecture.
Advanced competency with Microsoft Office suite.
Ability to collaborate with diverse stakeholders.
Ability to aggregate multiple data sources to generate and maintain data lakes.
Fluent in English – in reading, writing and speaking.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Senior IT Support Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
IT Technical Support – Join Marsh - the world's leading risk advisory and insurance brokerage firm




With over 45,000 employees across 130 countries, we empower Denmark's largest companies to navigate risks and seize business opportunities through our unrivaled expertise in risk management and insurance consulting. We are app. 150 colleagues in Denmark, eager to welcome you to our great organization.




As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.




Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.




What you can expect:




Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.




Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.




Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.




Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.




Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.




What you will be rewarded with:

Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values ​​diversity and innovation
Continuous learning and development opportunities to improve your skills and advance your career.
Competitive compensation and pension scheme
Global network of professionals providing opportunities for growth and mobility

We will rely on you to:

On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
On- and off boarding of colleagues
Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
Administer and prepare mobile devices.
Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.




What you need to have:

Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
Solid knowledge of software and hardware
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality

What makes you stand out:

Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.




Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.




Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age background, civil partnership status, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, gender reassignment, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




We are an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to providing reasonable adjustments in accordance with applicable law to any candidate with a disability to allow them to fully participate in the recruitment process. If you have a disability that may require reasonable adjustments, please contact us at reasonableaccommodations@mmc.com

At Marsh McLennan, we understand the complexity, and the reality, of the modern career path. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you would be a great fit for the role, we would love to hear from you.

With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.


    Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age background, civil partnership status, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, gender reassignment, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.


    We are an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to providing reasonable adjustments in accordance with applicable law to any candidate with a disability to allow them to fully participate in the recruitment process. If you have a disability that may require reasonable adjustments, please contact us at reasonableaccommodations@mmc.com

    At Marsh McLennan, we understand the complexity, and the reality, of the modern career path. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you would be a great fit for the role, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Uno-X Mobility Danmark
Description:
Vi søger en Business Intelligence Analyst til Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S




Hos Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S søger vi en ny Business Intelligence Analyst til vores BI-team, som vil være med til at styrke det nuværende BI-landskab og drive vores digitale udvikling fremad. Som Business Intelligence Analyst får du mulighed for at analysere data og levere indsigt, der understøtter strategiske beslutninger på tværs af organisationen.




Er du skarp til at indsamle, analysere og præsentere data på en måde, der skaber værdi og hjælper med at træffe bedre forretningsbeslutninger? Så er denne stilling måske noget for dig!




Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S er midt i en spændende udvikling, hvor vi ikke kun leverer moderne og relevante produkter til vores kunder, men også investerer massivt i digitalisering og data. Efter sammenlægningen af Uno-X og det tidligere YX i 2023 står vores IT-systemer over for en gennemgribende integrering med målet om "én virksomhed." Derudover er der stort fokus på at udvikle innovative dataløsninger, som skaber værdi både eksternt og internt.




Dine hovedopgaver:

Som Business Intelligence Analyst bliver du en del af et team, der er ansvarligt for at skabe data-drevne løsninger på tværs af organisationen. Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med forskellige afdelinger for at identificere deres behov og levere værdifulde rapporter og analyser.




Som Business Intelligence Analyst vil dine ansvarsområder omfatte:

Indsamling og analyse af data for at skabe indsigtsfulde rapporter og dashboards i Power BI.
Udvikling og vedligeholdelse af BI-løsninger, der understøtter virksomhedens strategi og operationelle beslutninger.
Transformere komplekse datasæt til letforståelige visualiseringer og anbefalinger.
Samarbejde med resten af BI teamet for at sikre datakvalitet og opretholde relevante datakilder.
Være proaktiv i at identificere muligheder for forbedring gennem dataanalyse.
Samarbejde tæt med alle forretningsområder for at forstå deres specifikke behov og sikre, at rapporter og analyser er tilpasset forretningsmålene og giver værdifuld indsigt til beslutningstagning.
Identificere og implementere muligheder for automatisering af rapporteringsprocesser og løbende forbedringer af BI-systemer.




Hvad forventer vi af dig?

Vi forestiller os, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du har arbejdet med dataanalyse og udvikling af rapporteringsløsninger. Du er analytisk, struktureret og god til at kommunikere dine indsigter til både tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter.




Opsummerende, for at have succes, skal du:

Have erfaring med Power BI til rapportering og datavisualisering.
Kunne omsætte komplekse data til klare, handlingsorienterede anbefalinger.
Være en stærk formidler, som kan præsentere resultater klart og forståeligt.
Være teamplayer og trives med at samarbejde på tværs af organisationen.




Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med resten af Power Platformen.




Hvad kan vi tilbyde?

Vi tilbyder en stærk kultur med gode værdier og fokus på at "bygge store mennesker." Vores arbejdsdag er præget af høj grad af tillid og ansvarstagen samt et langsigtet fokus, hvor der bygges sten på sten. Det har resulteret i et godt arbejdsmiljø med gode forhold og generelt en lang anciennitet i virksomheden.




Derudover har vi:

Et dynamisk og innovativt arbejdsmiljø med spændende opgaver.
Muligheden for at arbejde tæt sammen med forskellige afdelinger og interessenter.
En virksomhedskultur, der værdsætter fleksibilitet og effektivitet.
Konkurrencedygtig løn og gode ansættelsesvilkår.
Mulighed for personlig og faglig udvikling gennem projekter og udfordringer.




Om Uno-X

Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S er en del af norske REITAN Retail A/S. Vores mission er at udvikle og fremme løsninger for fremtidens mobilitet. Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S fokuserer på at drive og vedligeholde et effektivt netværk for flydende brændstof, samtidig med at vi, i samarbejde med vores søsterselskab, udvikler tilbud til elbilister, uanset hvor kunderne har behov for opladning.




Uno-X Mobility Danmark henvender sig til alle segmenter inden for mobilitet: Privat, erhverv, personbiler, varebiler og lastbiler. Herudover tilbyder vi leverancer inden for opvarmning, landbrug, entreprenør og marine.




Uno-X Mobility Danmark har hovedkontor i Søborg, en større omsætning i milliardklassen samt en solid indtjening på bundlinjen. Organisationen følger en lean-tankegang, hvor overflødige ledelseslag ikke eksisterer. Med andre ord, der er en flad organisationsstruktur og kort vej fra idé til handling. Det strategiske omdrejningspunkt for virksomheden er at skabe den bedste kundeoplevelse. Læs mere på www.unoxmobility.dk




Ansøg nu

Lyder jobbet som noget for dig? Så send din ansøgning samt CV via linket. Samtaler afholdes løbende. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte rekrutteringsansvarlig, Johan Hygum Hillers på johan@individuals.dk.




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig og til at byde en ny, engageret kollega velkommen til Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S!

Title: BI-Specialist with a finance background
Place: Vejle Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du træt af rutinemæssige månedsafslutninger i økonomiafdelingen?

IFACT A/S søger lige nu erfarne økonomiprofiler til vores Team af Business Intelligence Specialister. Så sidder du i dag i en rolle som Financial controller, Business controller, Regnskabs- eller Økonomichef, kan vi tilbyde dig en alternativ karrierevej med fuld fart på. Her slipper du af med de kedelige og rutineprægede månedsafslutninger, hvor resultatet altid er den samme kedelige månedsrapport leveret i Excel. Som BI Specialist vil du lære at arbejde med den nyeste BI-teknologi, der i kombination med din økonomiske og forretningsmæssige forståelse, vil gøre dig i stand til at automatisere genereringen af nøgletal til mange forskellige virksomheder – hver dag.

 

Vi giver din kompetenceudvikling epo og opgraderer dig til en mere nutidig og digital udgave af dig selv, hvor Microsoft Power BI bliver dit nye foretrukne våben.

 

Inden længe vil du få alle roserne, når kunderne bliver præsenteret for dine fede og brugervenlige BI-rapporter, for der sker virkelig noget, når folk for første gang ser deres data i en dynamisk og grafisk stærk BI-rapport.

 

Vi tilbyder en fuldtidsstilling med en fast månedsløn og pension, der matcher dine kompetencer og erfaring.

 

Din rolle

Du vil inden for relativt kort tid få en helt central rolle i vores team, hvor din primære opgave bliver at gennemskue kundernes forskellige datakilder for derefter at designe og opbygge skræddersyede BI-rapporter til deres brugere. 




I takt med din stigende selvstændighed holder du kunden i hånden fra onboarding til løbende support og videreudvikling af deres BI-løsning på vores platform. Derigennem får du dyb indsigt i virksomhedens nøgletal og datakilder. Du skal på samme tid formå at afkode kundens behov og opbygge en effektiv, logisk og struktureret teknisk løsning. Med andre ord "spitze EDB".

 

Du kommer til at sidde sammen med vores team på hovedkontoret i Vejle, hvor de mere erfarne BI Specialister glæder sig til at opgradere dig.

 

Baggrund og kvalifikationer

Du har mindst 5 års erfaring med økonomirapportering, hvor du har formået at hjælpe din organisation med værdiskabende ledelsesrapportering samt sparring.

 

Vi er helt med på, at du endnu ikke er fuldt kørende på BI-værktøjerne, men til gengæld er du sikkert superbruger i Excel herunder Pivot-tabeller og avancerede formler. Hos IFACT laver vi datamodeller i MS Azure SSAS med Visual Studio og selve rapporterne i MS Power BI.

 

Du har grundlæggende interesse for kundens virksomhed, og dermed behov, i relation til nøgletal og dataanalyser. Interessen og forståelsen gør dig i stand til, at skræddersy BI-rapporter efter kundens behov.

 

Du er udadvendt og kommunikativ i forhold til dine kollegaer og byder proaktivt ind med egen erfaring og løsningsforslag på problemer og udfordringer.

 

Du har en kreativ og kunstnerisk side, du bringer i spil, så kunderne får en wauw-oplevelse, når de ser deres BI-rapporter. Vi vil selv føle os stolte af vores løsninger, også når det kræver mange flere timer, end vi lige havde regnet med.

 

Du formår at holde fokus på en enkelt opgave, selvom du har mange forskelligartede opgaver i gang. Vi har et til tider hektisk miljø, med mange forskelligartede opgaver for forskellige kunder.

 

Vi glæder os til at høre fra DIG!

Du kan blive vores nye BI Specialist ved at give Henrik et kald på 41 83 14 80 eller sende os dit CV til hel@ifact.dk - du behøver ikke skrive nogen ansøgning.

 

Om IFACT

"IFACT A/S er en selvstændig virksomhed under Jansson Gruppen A/S. Vi har udviklet en ”State of the Art” BI-platform i Azure samt kompetencer til udvikling af de fedeste BI-rapporter og dashboards. Vores kunder abonnerer på en komplet BI-løsning, som vi driver og videreudvikler i tæt samarbejde med kunderne. Det kalder vi "BI as a service”. Det betyder også, at vi IKKE er en klassisk konsulentforretning med overdrevet fokus på udlastning af vores konsulenter.

 

Vi er en lille, men dedikeret, startup-organisation, der har alle fordele ved at indgå i en større koncern, og vi vokser hurtigt🚀. Vores mission er at gøre BI tilgængeligt for de virksomheder, der ikke selv har kræfter til at etablere og drive en BI-løsning. Vores promise er, at vi tager et stort medansvar for kundens ultimative succes med BI."
