Title: Operations Analyst & Power BI developer
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a proactive professional with a passion for business intelligence and operations? Do you want to develop creative analytics solutions that drive operational success? As an Operations Analyst and Power BI Developer, you'll collaborate with diverse, cross-functional teams, shaping the future of business intelligence for operations while growing your expertise within a global organization. This is your opportunity to influence our operations through data-driven insights. Are you ready to embrace the challenge and grow with us?

Hempel, a global leader in coatings and paints, is seeking a talent to achieve Hempel’s Double Impact strategy. Join our Operations Intelligence team as an Operations Analyst and Power BI Developer to make a meaningful impact on how we use data to transform business processes. With a team committed to operational excellence, you’ll collaborate with diverse colleagues and stakeholders across multiple functions to create intuitive dashboards and actionable insights. This role will enable you to influence key decisions and optimize business processes, while also growing your own expertise in business intelligence.

Here’s some of the other things you can look forward to

As an Operations Analyst and Power BI Developer, you will play a pivotal role in globalizing and optimizing our BI tools and processes. You’ll support Operations and the CTO organization by developing and maintaining interactive Power BI reports, dashboards, and analytics solutions that empower data-driven decision-making and strategic initiatives.


Develop and implement Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs, ensuring they align with strategic goals.
Partner with Operations and CTO functions like Operations, Production, Logistics, Planning, Sustainability, Procurement, R&D, Quality, Solution Management and many more to address BI-related topics and contribute to key data quality improvement initiatives.
Provide analytical support and guidance, while enabling regional stakeholders to utilize BI tools effectively.
Drive continuous improvement by globalizing existing BI tools, streamlining reporting processes, and enhancing operational efficiency.
Act as a liaison between the Digital team and report owners to develop, optimize, and deliver solutions that enhance data accessibility and usage.
Support the training and development of stakeholders in using BI tools to promote a culture of data-driven decision-making.


What do you need to be successful in this role?


Experience with data modelling and visualization tools preferably in Power BI.
Experience in developing, implementing, and maintaining BI solutions.
Good communication skills and the ability to translate complex technical solutions into simple, understandable answers for non-technical users. Experience with user training and/or support on BI tools is a plus.
Previous experience in a role requiring collaboration with cross-functional teams to address BI-related topics.
Knowledge of SQL and its application in BI environments is a plus.
Proficiency in English
Proactive with strong communication skills, able to advise on BI topics and work independently across teams.
Collaborative team player, focused on achieving goals, sharing knowledge, and growing in the BI and analytics field.


Sounds like a match?

Welcome to apply! Click the ‘Apply for position’ button in the top-right corner and submit your application letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system. Final deadline for applications is 24 October 2024. For further information about the job, please contact Line Friis - lif@hempel.com

More About Hempel

At Hempel, you’re welcomed into a global community of 7,500 colleagues around the world. A workplace built on shared trust, mutual respect and support for each other. 

We’re on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players. Which is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed but expected. In return, you will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company – and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact. 

At Hempel, we are committed to ensuring everyone feels safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work.  We believe that inclusion is key to innovation, and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together. 

We are proud to be majority owned by the Hempel Foundation, dedicated to philanthropic activities, with our earnings contributing to many charitable initiatives every year. It means that when you work at Hempel, your hard work and dedication contribute to a greater cause, making your career matter twice. 

Learn more about Hempel and our commitments on hempel.com/career. 

Application due

2024-10-24

Seniority Level

Associate

Job Functions

Analyst

Industry

Chemicals

Across the globe, Hempel’s coatings solutions protect surfaces, structures and equipment. They extend asset lifetimes, reduce maintenance costs and make homes and workplaces safer and more colourful. Hempel was founded in Copenhagen, Denmark in 1915 by J.C. Hempel, and is solely owned by the Hempel Foundation, which not only ensures a solid economic base for the company, but is dedicated to making a difference in the world by empowering children to learn, supporting coatings science and sustaining biodiversity.
Show more
HTML:
Are you a proactive professional with a passion for business intelligence and operations? Do you want to develop creative analytics solutions that drive operational success? As an Operations Analyst and Power BI Developer, you'll collaborate with diverse, cross-functional teams, shaping the future of business intelligence for operations while growing your expertise within a global organization. This is your opportunity to influence our operations through data-driven insights. Are you ready to embrace the challenge and grow with us?

Hempel, a global leader in coatings and paints, is seeking a talent to achieve Hempel’s Double Impact strategy. Join our Operations Intelligence team as an Operations Analyst and Power BI Developer to make a meaningful impact on how we use data to transform business processes. With a team committed to operational excellence, you’ll collaborate with diverse colleagues and stakeholders across multiple functions to create intuitive dashboards and actionable insights. This role will enable you to influence key decisions and optimize business processes, while also growing your own expertise in business intelligence.

Here’s some of the other things you can look forward to

As an Operations Analyst and Power BI Developer, you will play a pivotal role in globalizing and optimizing our BI tools and processes. You’ll support Operations and the CTO organization by developing and maintaining interactive Power BI reports, dashboards, and analytics solutions that empower data-driven decision-making and strategic initiatives.

  • Develop and implement Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs, ensuring they align with strategic goals.
  • Partner with Operations and CTO functions like Operations, Production, Logistics, Planning, Sustainability, Procurement, R&D, Quality, Solution Management and many more to address BI-related topics and contribute to key data quality improvement initiatives.
  • Provide analytical support and guidance, while enabling regional stakeholders to utilize BI tools effectively.
  • Drive continuous improvement by globalizing existing BI tools, streamlining reporting processes, and enhancing operational efficiency.
  • Act as a liaison between the Digital team and report owners to develop, optimize, and deliver solutions that enhance data accessibility and usage.
  • Support the training and development of stakeholders in using BI tools to promote a culture of data-driven decision-making.

What do you need to be successful in this role?

  • Experience with data modelling and visualization tools preferably in Power BI.
  • Experience in developing, implementing, and maintaining BI solutions.
  • Good communication skills and the ability to translate complex technical solutions into simple, understandable answers for non-technical users. Experience with user training and/or support on BI tools is a plus.
  • Previous experience in a role requiring collaboration with cross-functional teams to address BI-related topics.
  • Knowledge of SQL and its application in BI environments is a plus.
  • Proficiency in English
  • Proactive with strong communication skills, able to advise on BI topics and work independently across teams.
  • Collaborative team player, focused on achieving goals, sharing knowledge, and growing in the BI and analytics field.

Sounds like a match?

Welcome to apply! Click the ‘Apply for position’ button in the top-right corner and submit your application letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system. Final deadline for applications is 24 October 2024. For further information about the job, please contact Line Friis - lif@hempel.com

More About Hempel

At Hempel, you’re welcomed into a global community of 7,500 colleagues around the world. A workplace built on shared trust, mutual respect and support for each other. 

We’re on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players. Which is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed but expected. In return, you will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company – and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact. 

At Hempel, we are committed to ensuring everyone feels safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work.  We believe that inclusion is key to innovation, and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together. 

We are proud to be majority owned by the Hempel Foundation, dedicated to philanthropic activities, with our earnings contributing to many charitable initiatives every year. It means that when you work at Hempel, your hard work and dedication contribute to a greater cause, making your career matter twice. 

Learn more about Hempel and our commitments on hempel.com/career. 

Application due

2024-10-24

Seniority Level

Associate

Job Functions

Analyst

Industry

Chemicals

Across the globe, Hempel’s coatings solutions protect surfaces, structures and equipment. They extend asset lifetimes, reduce maintenance costs and make homes and workplaces safer and more colourful. Hempel was founded in Copenhagen, Denmark in 1915 by J.C. Hempel, and is solely owned by the Hempel Foundation, which not only ensures a solid economic base for the company, but is dedicated to making a difference in the world by empowering children to learn, supporting coatings science and sustaining biodiversity.

Title: Specialist, Data Analyst
Company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
Description:
Management | Full-Time | Information Technology

Are you enthusiastic about using data to ensure performance and improvement?

Vestas' Continuous Improvement and Analytics (CI&A) team seeks a Specialist Data Analyst to contribute to significant advancements in quality. If you're excited about turning complex data into clear insights and enjoy working in a global team, this role will give you the platform to influence meaningful change across the organization.

The Continuous Improvement and Analytics team (CI&A) is part of the global Vestas Quality organization.

The team's vision is to engage all Vestas colleagues, ensuring that Vestas consistently meets and exceeds break-through quality performance results. Key elements of this vision are


Providing ways of working for continuous improvement and quality analytics
Execution of high impact opportunities that deliver tangible results
Demonstrating how to use data to guide choices



Responsibilities


Providing simple, scalable and uniform ways of working for continuous improvement and quality analytics
Building a deep, data-based understanding of Vestas quality issues, risks and opportunities
Deploying and animating a performance management approach and culture to: (1) see deviations to target early; (2) resolve problems to the root cause and (3) to replicate learnings and prevent recurrence
Deepening the understanding of (dashboard) performance and trends
Proposing high-impact initiatives, priorities and smart targets
Realizing goals through the pursuit of impactful opportunities and providing leadership and assistance for strategic quality initiatives
Partnering across Vestas to build and animate a global community of continuous improvement and quality analytics leaders and equip them with the required competences
Acknowledging commendable procedures being implemented and improving upon established premier techniques for Operational Effectiveness, Design for Quality, Collaborative Involvement, and Transformation Guidance



Qualifications


An engineering or similar technical background, master of science or master of business administration, or other relevant experience
Possesses a certified black belt or similar qualification, with experience in effectively initiating positive changes
Proven achievements in Quality, Manufacturing, R&D, or Supply Chain, underpinned by 5-10 years of experience in modern Lean/Six Sigma organizations
Proficient in working with teams, you have well-developed communication and relationship-building skills, enabling clear dialogues with a wide range of contributors within the organizational structure
Proficient in people management and adept at facilitating change, notably through mentoring, guiding, encouraging, and advancing the professional growth of employees)
Capable of self-motivated and imaginative work, recognizing areas that require project enhancement
High ethical standards and integrity are "must haves"



Competencies


Solid, demonstrated analytical skills. Experience with several tools like Excel, SQL, PowerBI, Spotfire and Minitab, as well as scripting languages like Python or Matlab. Familiarity with Cloud Frontiers technologies, including Dataiku, Databricks, and Snowflake, is regarded as beneficial
Ability to mentor, coach and guide experts, managers & senior leaders on root cause analysis, improvement solutions & building business case
Good at building a network and establishing partnerships
Committed to realizing significant and verifiable progress with a focus on tangible outcomes
Agile and able to simplify complex problems into simple logical milestones
Proficient in English and adept at both verbal and written exchanges



What We Offer

As a specialist you will hold a key position in the well-established global Continuous Improvement and Analytics team. Your contributions significantly influence Vestas' performance. You will have the chance to collaborate intimately with our senior leadership and prepare them to be effective proponents of ongoing progress.

Additional Information

The primary work location is in Aarhus, Denmark.

To be considered for this role, you must apply online before October 13, 2024. We will review applications on an ongoing basis. We can withdraw from the job and reserve the right to do so at any time, including before the advertised closing date.

For more information, please get in touch with Jan Crielaard, Head of Global Continuous Improvement and Analytics, at +4527871597.

BEWARE - RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry's global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution - today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in building the data platforms of the future and shaping how Accenture will become the best in Denmark in AI!

We are currently a group of 20 members in Accenture's department and specialist group for data and artificial intelligence, and we need more wise and committed minds to join our team! As part of Accenture's Data & AI community, you will help build data solutions as well as our internal professional environment within the field.

In our projects, you use a range of skills. We work with data engineering, frontend and backend development, DevOps, data architecture, machine learning and Generative AI. You yourself will have an influence on everyday working life based on what you want to work with. At Accenture, you are in the driver's seat for your future technology career, regardless of whether you want to become a technical expert or a manager with a broad technology background. Accenture is a career school where we guide and learn from each other.

Who are we looking for?

To give you a clearer impression of who we are, we present two of our employees' everyday working life below. We are looking for more AI enthusiasts like Chris and Aurora, with similar ambitions and courage to become part of our active and forward-looking professional environment. In this professional environment, we work with the latest technology in AI and Cloud, organize workshops internally and in customer projects, support technology sales and develop high-quality solutions for our customers.

You are solution-oriented, curious and like to familiarize yourself with new issues where you share your knowledge. You must be happy to work in a team, while also being able to work independently with demanding tasks for our customers.

We are looking for you who:



Has 3+ years of relevant work experience


Has a burning interest in data engineering and artificial intelligence


Has experience with system development, frontend or backend


Has experience with Azure, Google Cloud Platform or AWS


Has practical experience with AI/ML and relevant technologies


Preferably speaks Danish



What can we offer you?



Opportunity to work with frontier technologies on exciting projects with leading companies across various industries


Professional development and training opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career


A local as well as global network


A competitive salary and benefits



Chris's everyday life at Accenture

I studied physics and mathematics and delved into quantum machine learning during my master's. Since I finished my studies in 2022, I have worked at Accenture as a data engineer in the Data&AI department. In my role as backend developer on a significant data platform project for one of our larger clients, I have mainly focused on backend development. I have also had the pleasure of exploring other areas such as front-end development and work with software release strategies, as well as CI/CD automation. This has given me a wide range of skills and experiences in various aspects of software development.

I am actively involved in our vibrant Data&AI community. We regularly organize presentations and invite external speakers to keep us up to date on the latest trends and innovations in the field. In addition, I take regular artificial intelligences and data-related courses to keep up to date with the ever-developing professional landscape. For me, the social aspect is just as important as the academic aspect. Fortunately, this is a group where well-being and togetherness are the focus. We see each other as friends as well as colleagues, and together we organize everything from social events to professional gatherings.

Aurora’s everyday life at Accenture

I have worked as a data engineer in Data&AI since 2022, after studying Computer Science and Engineering at DTU. At university, I immersed myself in various machine learning subjects, and finally ended up with a master's on predicting ship activity in the (partly untouched) Arctic. The combination of data analysis and ML algorithms added flavor, and luckily I get the opportunity to continue exploring this field here at Accenture, with fantastically talented and good colleagues!

I have previously worked on the same project as Chris as data engineer for a large digital transformation, where we use a number of technologies and frameworks for end-to-end development. I am currently on a smaller project working on developing a Generative AI solution through OpenAI. It is incredibly exciting and meaningful to apply today's technology to well-established processes at well-known players. GenAI is a hot topic, which is shown through great commitment to the project within Accenture and at the customer.

In addition to project work, I help lead Accenture's female mentorship program for university students. So there is a lot of variety that you can get involved in, while at the same time you have your belonging in our exotic Data & AI community. Here we are friends and colleagues with the same interests, although there is great variation in the number of years of experience and types of projects, which creates a fantastic starting point to learn from each other. Good atmosphere, low shoulders and commitment!

Does this sound interesting?

Then we would like to hear from you! Paradoxically, we prefer application letters not written by ChatGPT.


Show more

Title: Lead Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Redstone Commodity Search focus on offering 360° search solutions to the global commodities markets. With a competitive coverage of Trading Houses, Producers, Majors, Utilities, Merchants, Hedge Funds, Investment Banks and Brokerages; Redstone Commodity Search can confidently offer you an edge in today’s volatile market.




Redstone Commodity Search are working with an established Danish Commodities Trading House, in their search for a Lead Quantitative Researcher to join the growing Energy team.




Key Responsibilities / Tasks




Focus on EU power and Gas markets, seeking out new opportunities and trends.
Build models to power quantitative strategies.
Conduct research and statistical analysis.
Ensure compliance with regulations and reporting within the Energy Market.
Work with large data sets to predict and test statistical market patterns.
Role reports into the Director of Power Trading.




Key Qualifications / Experience




Having a broad understanding of international power and gas fundamentals.
Analytical mindset and strong ability to navigate the markets.
3+ years of relevant quantitative experience.
Master’s degree in finance, mathematics, economics, or a relevant field.
Strong attention to detail, and numerical accuracy.
Located in Denmark.

Show more
